qcommon.h File Reference

definitions common between client and server, but not game.or ref modules. More...

  CF_RDTSC = 1 << 0, CF_MMX = 1 << 1, CF_MMX_EXT = 1 << 2, CF_3DNOW = 1 << 3,
  CF_3DNOW_EXT = 1 << 4, CF_SSE = 1 << 5, CF_SSE2 = 1 << 6, CF_ALTIVEC = 1 << 7
}

Detailed Description

definitions common between client and server, but not game.or ref modules.

Definition in file qcommon.h.

◆ Cbuf_Execute()

void Cbuf_Execute ( void  )

Definition at line 172 of file cmd.c.

173 {
174  int i;
175  char *text;
176  char line[MAX_CMD_LINE];
177  int quotes;
178 
179  // This will keep // style comments all on one line by not breaking on
180  // a semicolon. It will keep /* ... */ style comments all on one line by not
181  // breaking it for semicolon or newline.
182  qboolean in_star_comment = qfalse;
183  qboolean in_slash_comment = qfalse;
184  while (cmd_text.cursize)
185  {
186  if ( cmd_wait > 0 ) {
187  // skip out while text still remains in buffer, leaving it
188  // for next frame
189  cmd_wait--;
190  break;
191  }
192 
193  // find a \n or ; line break or comment: // or /* */
194  text = (char *)cmd_text.data;
195 
196  quotes = 0;
197  for (i=0 ; i< cmd_text.cursize ; i++)
198  {
199  if (text[i] == '"')
200  quotes++;
201 
202  if ( !(quotes&1)) {
203  if (i < cmd_text.cursize - 1) {
204  if (! in_star_comment && text[i] == '/' && text[i+1] == '/')
205  in_slash_comment = qtrue;
206  else if (! in_slash_comment && text[i] == '/' && text[i+1] == '*')
207  in_star_comment = qtrue;
208  else if (in_star_comment && text[i] == '*' && text[i+1] == '/') {
209  in_star_comment = qfalse;
210  // If we are in a star comment, then the part after it is valid
211  // Note: This will cause it to NUL out the terminating '/'
212  // but ExecuteString doesn't require it anyway.
213  i++;
214  break;
215  }
216  }
217  if (! in_slash_comment && ! in_star_comment && text[i] == ';')
218  break;
219  }
220  if (! in_star_comment && (text[i] == '\n' || text[i] == '\r')) {
221  in_slash_comment = qfalse;
222  break;
223  }
224  }
225 
226  if( i >= (MAX_CMD_LINE - 1)) {
227  i = MAX_CMD_LINE - 1;
228  }
229 
230  Com_Memcpy (line, text, i);
231  line[i] = 0;
232 
233 // delete the text from the command buffer and move remaining commands down
234 // this is necessary because commands (exec) can insert data at the
235 // beginning of the text buffer
236 
237  if (i == cmd_text.cursize)
238  cmd_text.cursize = 0;
239  else
240  {
241  i++;
242  cmd_text.cursize -= i;
243  memmove (text, text+i, cmd_text.cursize);
244  }
245 
246 // execute the command line
247 
248  Cmd_ExecuteString (line);
249  }
250 }

Referenced by Cbuf_ExecuteText(), CL_NextDemo(), Com_ExecuteCfg(), and Com_Frame().

◆ Cbuf_ExecuteText()

void Cbuf_ExecuteText ( int  exec_when,
const char *  text 
)

Definition at line 143 of file cmd.c.

144 {
145  switch (exec_when)
146  {
147  case EXEC_NOW:
148  if (text && strlen(text) > 0) {
149  Com_DPrintf(S_COLOR_YELLOW "EXEC_NOW %s\n", text);
150  Cmd_ExecuteString (text);
151  } else {
152  Cbuf_Execute();
153  Com_DPrintf(S_COLOR_YELLOW "EXEC_NOW %s\n", cmd_text.data);
154  }
155  break;
156  case EXEC_INSERT:
157  Cbuf_InsertText (text);
158  break;
159  case EXEC_APPEND:
160  Cbuf_AddText (text);
161  break;
162  default:
163  Com_Error (ERR_FATAL, "Cbuf_ExecuteText: bad exec_when");
164  }
165 }

◆ CL_ConsolePrint()

void CL_ConsolePrint ( char *  text)

Definition at line 434 of file cl_console.c.

434  {
435  int y, l;
436  unsigned char c;
437  unsigned short color;
438  qboolean skipnotify = qfalse; // NERVE - SMF
439  int prev; // NERVE - SMF
440 
441  // TTimo - prefix for text that shows up in console but not in notify
442  // backported from RTCW
443  if ( !Q_strncmp( txt, "[skipnotify]", 12 ) ) {
444  skipnotify = qtrue;
445  txt += 12;
446  }
447 
448  // for some demos we don't want to ever show anything on the console
449  if ( cl_noprint && cl_noprint->integer ) {
450  return;
451  }
452 
453  if (!con.initialized) {
454  con.color[0] =
455  con.color[1] =
456  con.color[2] =
457  con.color[3] = 1.0f;
458  con.linewidth = -1;
459  Con_CheckResize ();
460  con.initialized = qtrue;
461  }
462 
463  color = ColorIndex(COLOR_WHITE);
464 
465  while ( (c = *((unsigned char *) txt)) != 0 ) {
466  if ( Q_IsColorString( txt ) ) {
467  color = ColorIndex( *(txt+1) );
468  txt += 2;
469  continue;
470  }
471 
472  // count word length
473  for (l=0 ; l< con.linewidth ; l++) {
474  if ( txt[l] <= ' ') {
475  break;
476  }
477 
478  }
479 
480  // word wrap
481  if (l != con.linewidth && (con.x + l >= con.linewidth) ) {
482  Con_Linefeed(skipnotify);
483 
484  }
485 
486  txt++;
487 
488  switch (c)
489  {
490  case '\n':
491  Con_Linefeed (skipnotify);
492  break;
493  case '\r':
494  con.x = 0;
495  break;
496  default: // display character and advance
497  y = con.current % con.totallines;
498  con.text[y*con.linewidth+con.x] = (color << 8) | c;
499  con.x++;
500  if(con.x >= con.linewidth)
501  Con_Linefeed(skipnotify);
502  break;
503  }
504  }
505 
506 
507  // mark time for transparent overlay
508  if (con.current >= 0) {
509  // NERVE - SMF
510  if ( skipnotify ) {
511  prev = con.current % NUM_CON_TIMES - 1;
512  if ( prev < 0 )
513  prev = NUM_CON_TIMES - 1;
514  con.times[prev] = 0;
515  }
516  else
517  // -NERVE - SMF
518  con.times[con.current % NUM_CON_TIMES] = cls.realtime;
519  }
520 }

768  return; // no tokens

775  // rearrange the links so that the command will be
776  // near the head of the list next time it is used
777  *prev = cmd->next;
778  cmd->next = cmd_functions;
779  cmd_functions = cmd;
780 
781  // perform the action
782  if ( !cmd->function ) {
783  // let the cgame or game handle it
784  break;
785  } else {
786  cmd->function ();
787  }
788  return;
789  }
790  }

794  return;

799  return;
800  }

804  return;
805  }
806

809  return;
810  }

813  // this will usually result in a chat message

815 }

◆ Com_Filter()

int Com_Filter ( char *  filter,
char *  name,
int  casesensitive 
)

Definition at line 619 of file common.c.

620 {
621  char buf[MAX_TOKEN_CHARS];
622  char *ptr;
623  int i, found;
624 
625  while(*filter) {
626  if (*filter == '*') {
627  filter++;
628  for (i = 0; *filter; i++) {
629  if (*filter == '*' || *filter == '?') break;
630  buf[i] = *filter;
631  filter++;
632  }
633  buf[i] = '\0';
634  if (strlen(buf)) {
635  ptr = Com_StringContains(name, buf, casesensitive);
636  if (!ptr) return qfalse;
637  name = ptr + strlen(buf);
638  }
639  }
640  else if (*filter == '?') {
641  filter++;
642  name++;
643  }
644  else if (*filter == '[' && *(filter+1) == '[') {
645  filter++;
646  }
647  else if (*filter == '[') {
648  filter++;
649  found = qfalse;
650  while(*filter && !found) {
651  if (*filter == ']' && *(filter+1) != ']') break;
652  if (*(filter+1) == '-' && *(filter+2) && (*(filter+2) != ']' || *(filter+3) == ']')) {
653  if (casesensitive) {
654  if (*name >= *filter && *name <= *(filter+2)) found = qtrue;
655  }
656  else {
657  if (toupper(*name) >= toupper(*filter) &&
658  toupper(*name) <= toupper(*(filter+2))) found = qtrue;
659  }
660  filter += 3;
661  }
662  else {
663  if (casesensitive) {
664  if (*filter == *name) found = qtrue;
665  }
666  else {
667  if (toupper(*filter) == toupper(*name)) found = qtrue;
668  }
669  filter++;
670  }
671  }
672  if (!found) return qfalse;
673  while(*filter) {
674  if (*filter == ']' && *(filter+1) != ']') break;
675  filter++;
676  }
677  filter++;
678  name++;
679  }
680  else {
681  if (casesensitive) {
682  if (*filter != *name) return qfalse;
683  }
684  else {
685  if (toupper(*filter) != toupper(*name)) return qfalse;
686  }
687  filter++;
688  name++;
689  }
690  }
691  return qtrue;
692 }

3123  // that framerate is stable at the requested value.

3137

273 
274  filelen = FS_SV_FOpenFileRead( fn, &f );
275 
276  if( !f ) {
277  return final;
278  }
279  if( filelen < 1 ) {
280  FS_FCloseFile( f );
281  return final;
282  }
283  if(filelen < length || !length) {
284  length = filelen;
285  }
286

288 
289  if( prefix_len && *prefix )
290  MD5Update(&md5 , (unsigned char *)prefix, prefix_len);
291 
292  for(;;) {
293  r = FS_Read(buffer, sizeof(buffer), f);
294  if(r < 1)
295  break;
296  if(r + total > length)
297  r = length - total;
298  total += r;
299  MD5Update(&md5 , buffer, r);
300  if(r < sizeof(buffer) || total >= length)
301  break;
302  }
303  FS_FCloseFile(f);
304  MD5Final(&md5, digest);
305  final[0] = '\0';
306  for(i = 0; i < 16; i++) {
307  Q_strcat(final, sizeof(final), va("%02X", digest[i]));
308  }
309  return final;
310 }

377  // don't try to shutdown if we are in a recursive error

379  if ( !com_errorEntered ) {
380  // Some VMs might execute "quit" command directly,
381  // which would trigger an unload of active VM error.

383  // a corrupt call stack makes no difference

◆ Cvar_Get()

cvar_t* Cvar_Get ( const char *  var_name,
const char *  value,
int  flags 
)

Definition at line 310 of file cvar.c.

310  {
311  cvar_t *var;
312  long hash;
313  int index;
314 
315  if ( !var_name || ! var_value ) {
316  Com_Error( ERR_FATAL, "Cvar_Get: NULL parameter" );
317  }
318 
319  if ( !Cvar_ValidateString( var_name ) ) {
320  Com_Printf("invalid cvar name string: %s\n", var_name );
321  var_name = "BADNAME";
322  }
323 
324 #if 0 // FIXME: values with backslash happen
325  if ( !Cvar_ValidateString( var_value ) ) {
326  Com_Printf("invalid cvar value string: %s\n", var_value );
327  var_value = "BADVALUE";
328  }
329 #endif
330 
331  var = Cvar_FindVar (var_name);
332 
333  if(var)
334  {
335  var_value = Cvar_Validate(var, var_value, qfalse);
336 
337  // Make sure the game code cannot mark engine-added variables as gamecode vars
338  if(var->flags & CVAR_VM_CREATED)
339  {
340  if(!(flags & CVAR_VM_CREATED))
341  var->flags &= ~CVAR_VM_CREATED;
342  }
343  else if (!(var->flags & CVAR_USER_CREATED))
344  {
345  if(flags & CVAR_VM_CREATED)
346  flags &= ~CVAR_VM_CREATED;
347  }
348 
349  // if the C code is now specifying a variable that the user already
350  // set a value for, take the new value as the reset value
351  if(var->flags & CVAR_USER_CREATED)
352  {
353  var->flags &= ~CVAR_USER_CREATED;
354  Z_Free( var->resetString );
355  var->resetString = CopyString( var_value );
356 
357  if(flags & CVAR_ROM)
358  {
359  // this variable was set by the user,
360  // so force it to value given by the engine.
361 
362  if(var->latchedString)
363  Z_Free(var->latchedString);
364 
365  var->latchedString = CopyString(var_value);
366  }
367  }
368 
369  // Make sure servers cannot mark engine-added variables as SERVER_CREATED
370  if(var->flags & CVAR_SERVER_CREATED)
371  {
372  if(!(flags & CVAR_SERVER_CREATED))
373  var->flags &= ~CVAR_SERVER_CREATED;
374  }
375  else
376  {
377  if(flags & CVAR_SERVER_CREATED)
378  flags &= ~CVAR_SERVER_CREATED;
379  }
380 
381  var->flags |= flags;
382 
383  // only allow one non-empty reset string without a warning
384  if ( !var->resetString[0] ) {
385  // we don't have a reset string yet
386  Z_Free( var->resetString );
387  var->resetString = CopyString( var_value );
388  } else if ( var_value[0] && strcmp( var->resetString, var_value ) ) {
389  Com_DPrintf( "Warning: cvar \"%s\" given initial values: \"%s\" and \"%s\"\n",
390  var_name, var->resetString, var_value );
391  }
392  // if we have a latched string, take that value now
393  if ( var->latchedString ) {
394  char *s;
395 
396  s = var->latchedString;
397  var->latchedString = NULL; // otherwise cvar_set2 would free it
398  Cvar_Set2( var_name, s, qtrue );
399  Z_Free( s );
400  }
401 
402  // ZOID--needs to be set so that cvars the game sets as
403  // SERVERINFO get sent to clients
404  cvar_modifiedFlags |= flags;
405 
406  return var;
407  }
408 
409  //
410  // allocate a new cvar
411  //
412 
413  // find a free cvar
414  for(index = 0; index < MAX_CVARS; index++)
415  {
416  if(!cvar_indexes[index].name)
417  break;
418  }
419 
420  if(index >= MAX_CVARS)
421  {
422  if(!com_errorEntered)
423  Com_Error(ERR_FATAL, "Error: Too many cvars, cannot create a new one!");
424 
425  return NULL;
426  }
427 
428  var = &cvar_indexes[index];
429 
430  if(index >= cvar_numIndexes)
431  cvar_numIndexes = index + 1;
432 
433  var->name = CopyString (var_name);
434  var->string = CopyString (var_value);
435  var->modified = qtrue;
436  var->modificationCount = 1;
437  var->value = atof (var->string);
438  var->integer = atoi(var->string);
439  var->resetString = CopyString( var_value );
440  var->validate = qfalse;
441  var->description = NULL;
442 
443  // link the variable in
444  var->next = cvar_vars;
445  if(cvar_vars)
446  cvar_vars->prev = var;
447 
448  var->prev = NULL;
449  cvar_vars = var;
450 
451  var->flags = flags;
452  // note what types of cvars have been modified (userinfo, archive, serverinfo, systeminfo)
453  cvar_modifiedFlags |= var->flags;
454 
455  hash = generateHashValue(var_name);
456  var->hashIndex = hash;
457 
458  var->hashNext = hashTable[hash];
459  if(hashTable[hash])
460  hashTable[hash]->hashPrev = var;
461 
462  var->hashPrev = NULL;
463  hashTable[hash] = var;
464 
465  return var;
466 }

◆ Cvar_Register()

void Cvar_Register ( vmCvar_t *  vmCvar,
const char *  varName,
const char *  defaultValue,
int  flags 
)

Definition at line 1325 of file cvar.c.

1326 {
1327  cvar_t *cv;
1328 
1329  // There is code in Cvar_Get to prevent CVAR_ROM cvars being changed by the
1330  // user. In other words CVAR_ARCHIVE and CVAR_ROM are mutually exclusive
1331  // flags. Unfortunately some historical game code (including single player
1332  // baseq3) sets both flags. We unset CVAR_ROM for such cvars.
1333  if ((flags & (CVAR_ARCHIVE | CVAR_ROM)) == (CVAR_ARCHIVE | CVAR_ROM)) {
1334  Com_DPrintf( S_COLOR_YELLOW "WARNING: Unsetting CVAR_ROM from cvar '%s', "
1335  "since it is also CVAR_ARCHIVE\n", varName );
1336  flags &= ~CVAR_ROM;
1337  }
1338 
1339  // Don't allow VM to specific a different creator or other internal flags.
1340  if ( flags & CVAR_USER_CREATED ) {
1341  Com_DPrintf( S_COLOR_YELLOW "WARNING: VM tried to set CVAR_USER_CREATED on cvar '%s'\n", varName );
1342  flags &= ~CVAR_USER_CREATED;
1343  }
1344  if ( flags & CVAR_SERVER_CREATED ) {
1345  Com_DPrintf( S_COLOR_YELLOW "WARNING: VM tried to set CVAR_SERVER_CREATED on cvar '%s'\n", varName );
1346  flags &= ~CVAR_SERVER_CREATED;
1347  }
1348  if ( flags & CVAR_PROTECTED ) {
1349  Com_DPrintf( S_COLOR_YELLOW "WARNING: VM tried to set CVAR_PROTECTED on cvar '%s'\n", varName );
1350  flags &= ~CVAR_PROTECTED;
1351  }
1352  if ( flags & CVAR_MODIFIED ) {
1353  Com_DPrintf( S_COLOR_YELLOW "WARNING: VM tried to set CVAR_MODIFIED on cvar '%s'\n", varName );
1354  flags &= ~CVAR_MODIFIED;
1355  }
1356  if ( flags & CVAR_NONEXISTENT ) {
1357  Com_DPrintf( S_COLOR_YELLOW "WARNING: VM tried to set CVAR_NONEXISTENT on cvar '%s'\n", varName );
1358  flags &= ~CVAR_NONEXISTENT;
1359  }
1360 
1361  cv = Cvar_FindVar(varName);
1362 
1363  // Don't modify cvar if it's protected.
1364  if ( cv && ( cv->flags & CVAR_PROTECTED ) ) {
1365  Com_DPrintf( S_COLOR_YELLOW "WARNING: VM tried to register protected cvar '%s' with value '%s'%s\n",
1366  varName, defaultValue, ( flags & ~cv->flags ) != 0 ? " and new flags" : "" );
1367  } else {
1368  cv = Cvar_Get(varName, defaultValue, flags | CVAR_VM_CREATED);
1369  }
1370 
1371  if (!vmCvar)
1372  return;
1373 
1374  vmCvar->handle = cv - cvar_indexes;
1375  vmCvar->modificationCount = -1;
1376  Cvar_Update( vmCvar );
1377 }

504  {
505  cvar_t *var;
506 
507 // Com_DPrintf( "Cvar_Set2: %s %s\n", var_name, value );
508 
509  if ( !Cvar_ValidateString( var_name ) ) {

512  }
513 
514 #if 0 // FIXME
515  if ( value && !Cvar_ValidateString( value ) ) {
516  Com_Printf("invalid cvar value string: %s\n", value );
517  var_value = "BADVALUE";
518  }
519 #endif
520 
521  var = Cvar_FindVar (var_name);
522  if (!var) {
523  if ( !value ) {
524  return NULL;
525  }
526  // create it
527  if ( !force ) {
528  return Cvar_Get( var_name, value, CVAR_USER_CREATED );
529  } else {
530  return Cvar_Get (var_name, value, 0);
531  }
532  }
533 
534  if (!value ) {
535  value = var->resetString;
536  }
537 
538  value = Cvar_Validate(var, value, qtrue);
539 
540  if((var->flags & CVAR_LATCH) && var->latchedString)
541  {
542  if(!strcmp(value, var->string))
543  {
544  Z_Free(var->latchedString);
545  var->latchedString = NULL;
546  return var;
547  }
548 
549  if(!strcmp(value, var->latchedString))
550  return var;
551  }
552  else if(!strcmp(value, var->string))
553  return var;
554 
555  // note what types of cvars have been modified (userinfo, archive, serverinfo, systeminfo)
556  cvar_modifiedFlags |= var->flags;
557 
558  if (!force)
559  {
560  if (var->flags & CVAR_ROM)
561  {
562  Com_Printf ("%s is read only.\n", var_name);
563  return var;
564  }
565 
566  if (var->flags & CVAR_INIT)
567  {
568  Com_Printf ("%s is write protected.\n", var_name);
569  return var;
570  }
571 
572  if ((var->flags & CVAR_CHEAT) && !cvar_cheats->integer)
573  {
574  Com_Printf ("%s is cheat protected.\n", var_name);
575  return var;
576  }
577 
578  if (var->flags & CVAR_LATCH)
579  {
580  if (var->latchedString)
581  {
582  if (strcmp(value, var->latchedString) == 0)
583  return var;
584  Z_Free (var->latchedString);
585  }
586  else
587  {
588  if (strcmp(value, var->string) == 0)
589  return var;
590  }
591 
592  Com_Printf ("%s will be changed upon restarting.\n", var_name);
593  var->latchedString = CopyString(value);
594  var->modified = qtrue;
595  var->modificationCount++;
596  return var;
597  }
598  }
599  else
600  {
601  if (var->latchedString)
602  {
603  Z_Free (var->latchedString);
604  var->latchedString = NULL;
605  }
606  }
607 
608  if (!strcmp(value, var->string))
609  return var; // not changed
610 
611  var->modified = qtrue;
612  var->modificationCount++;
613 
614  Z_Free (var->string); // free the old value string
615 
616  var->string = CopyString(value);
617  var->value = atof (var->string);
618  var->integer = atoi (var->string);
619 
620  return var;
621 }

◆ Cvar_Update()

void Cvar_Update ( vmCvar_t *  vmCvar)

1387  {
1388  cvar_t *cv = NULL;
1389  assert(vmCvar);
1390

void FS_AddGameDirectory ( const char *  path,

)

Sets fs_gamedir, adds the directory to the head of the path, then loads the zip headers.

Parameters

2911 {
2912  searchpath_t* sp;
2913  searchpath_t* search;
2914  pack_t* pak;
2915  char curpath[MAX_OSPATH + 1], * pakfile;
2916  int numfiles;

2918  int pakfilesi;
2919  char** pakfilestmp;
2920  int numdirs;
2921  char** pakdirs;
2922  int pakdirsi;
2923  char** pakdirstmp;
2924 
2925  int pakwhich;
2926  int len;
2927 
2928  // Unique
2929  for (sp = fs_searchpaths; sp; sp = sp->next) {
2930  if (sp->dir && !Q_stricmp(sp->dir->path, path) && !Q_stricmp(sp->dir->gamedir, dir)) {
2931  return; // we've already got this one
2932  }
2933  }
2934 
2935  Q_strncpyz(fs_gamedir, dir, sizeof(fs_gamedir));
2936 
2937  // find all pak files in this directory
2938  Q_strncpyz(curpath, FS_BuildOSPath(path, dir, ""), sizeof(curpath));
2939  curpath[strlen(curpath) - 1] = '\0'; // strip the trailing slash
2940 
2941  // Get .pk3 files
2942  pakfiles = Sys_ListFiles(curpath, ".pk3", NULL, &numfiles, qfalse);
2943 
2944  qsort(pakfiles, numfiles, sizeof(char*), paksort);
2945 
2946  if (fs_numServerPaks) {
2947  numdirs = 0;
2948  pakdirs = NULL;
2949  } else {
2950  // Get top level directories (we'll filter them later since the Sys_ListFiles filtering is terrible)
2951  pakdirs = Sys_ListFiles(curpath, "/", NULL, &numdirs, qfalse);
2952 
2953  qsort(pakdirs, numdirs, sizeof(char*), paksort);
2954  }
2955 
2956  pakfilesi = 0;
2957  pakdirsi = 0;
2958 
2959  while ((pakfilesi < numfiles) || (pakdirsi < numdirs)) {
2960  // Check if a pakfile or pakdir comes next
2961  if (pakfilesi >= numfiles) {
2962  // We've used all the pakfiles, it must be a pakdir.
2963  pakwhich = 0;
2964  } else if (pakdirsi >= numdirs) {
2965  // We've used all the pakdirs, it must be a pakfile.
2966  pakwhich = 1;
2967  } else {
2968  // Could be either, compare to see which name comes first
2969  // Need tmp variables for appropriate indirection for paksort()
2970  pakfilestmp = &pakfiles[pakfilesi];
2971  pakdirstmp = &pakdirs[pakdirsi];
2972  pakwhich = (paksort(pakfilestmp, pakdirstmp) < 0);
2973  }
2974 
2975  if (pakwhich) {
2976  // The next .pk3 file is before the next .pk3dir
2977  pakfile = FS_BuildOSPath(path, dir, pakfiles[pakfilesi]);
2978  if ((pak = FS_LoadZipFile(pakfile, pakfiles[pakfilesi])) == 0) {
2979  // This isn't a .pk3! Next!
2980  pakfilesi++;
2981  continue;
2982  }
2983 
2984  Q_strncpyz(pak->pakPathname, curpath, sizeof(pak->pakPathname));
2985  // store the game name for downloading
2986  Q_strncpyz(pak->pakGamename, dir, sizeof(pak->pakGamename));
2987 
2988  fs_packFiles += pak->numfiles;
2989 
2990  search = Z_Malloc(sizeof(searchpath_t));
2991  search->pack = pak;
2992  search->next = fs_searchpaths;
2993  fs_searchpaths = search;
2994 
2995  pakfilesi++;
2996  } else {
2997  // The next .pk3dir is before the next .pk3 file
2998  // But wait, this could be any directory, we're filtering to only ending with ".pk3dir" here.
2999  len = strlen(pakdirs[pakdirsi]);
3000  if (!FS_IsExt(pakdirs[pakdirsi], ".pk3dir", len)) {
3001  // This isn't a .pk3dir! Next!
3002  pakdirsi++;
3003  continue;
3004  }
3005 
3006  pakfile = FS_BuildOSPath(path, dir, pakdirs[pakdirsi]);
3007 
3008  // add the directory to the search path
3009  search = Z_Malloc(sizeof(searchpath_t));
3010  search->dir = Z_Malloc(sizeof(*search->dir));
3011 
3012  Q_strncpyz(search->dir->path, curpath, sizeof(search->dir->path)); // c:\quake3\baseq3
3013  Q_strncpyz(search->dir->fullpath, pakfile, sizeof(search->dir->fullpath)); // c:\quake3\baseq3\mypak.pk3dir
3014  Q_strncpyz(search->dir->gamedir, pakdirs[pakdirsi], sizeof(search->dir->gamedir)); // mypak.pk3dir
3015 
3016  search->next = fs_searchpaths;
3017  fs_searchpaths = search;
3018 
3019  pakdirsi++;

3021  }
3022

3025  Sys_FreeFileList(pakdirs);
3026 
3027  //
3028  // add the directory to the search path
3029  //
3030  search = Z_Malloc(sizeof(searchpath_t));

3032 
3033  Q_strncpyz(search->dir->path, path, sizeof(search->dir->path));

3039 }

◆ FS_ComparePaks()

qboolean FS_ComparePaks ( char *  neededpaks,
int  len,
qboolean  dlstring 
)

FS_ComparePaks.

dlstring == qtrue

Returns a list of pak files that we should download from the server. They all get stored in the current gamedir and an FS_Restart will be fired up after we download them all.

The string is the format:

@remotename@localname [repeat]

static int fs_numServerReferencedPaks; static int fs_serverReferencedPaks[MAX_SEARCH_PATHS]; static char *fs_serverReferencedPakNames[MAX_SEARCH_PATHS];

dlstring == qfalse

we are not interested in a download string format, we want something human-readable. (this is used for diagnostics while connecting to a pure server).

Parameters
neededpaks
len
dlstring
Returns

Definition at line 3122 of file files.c.

3123 {
3124  searchpath_t* sp;
3125  qboolean havepak;
3126  char* origpos = neededpaks;
3127  int i;
3128 
3129  if (!fs_numServerReferencedPaks)
3130  return qfalse; // Server didn't send any pack information along
3131 
3132  *neededpaks = 0;
3133 
3134  for (i = 0; i < fs_numServerReferencedPaks; i++) {
3135  // Ok, see if we have this pak file
3136  havepak = qfalse;
3137 
3138  // never autodownload any of the id paks
3139  if (FS_idPak(fs_serverReferencedPakNames[i], BASEGAME, NUM_ID_PAKS)
3140 #ifndef STANDALONE
3141  || FS_idPak(fs_serverReferencedPakNames[i], BASETA, NUM_TA_PAKS)
3142 #endif
3143  ) {
3144  continue;
3145  }
3146 
3147  // Make sure the server cannot make us write to non-quake3 directories.
3148  if (FS_CheckDirTraversal(fs_serverReferencedPakNames[i])) {
3149  Com_Printf("WARNING: Invalid download name %s\n", fs_serverReferencedPakNames[i]);
3150  continue;
3151  }
3152 
3153  for (sp = fs_searchpaths; sp; sp = sp->next) {
3154  if (sp->pack && sp->pack->checksum == fs_serverReferencedPaks[i]) {
3155  havepak = qtrue; // This is it!
3156  break;
3157  }
3158  }
3159 
3160  if (!havepak && fs_serverReferencedPakNames[i] && *fs_serverReferencedPakNames[i]) {
3161  // Don't got it
3162 
3163  if (dlstring) {
3164  // We need this to make sure we won't hit the end of the buffer or the server could
3165  // overwrite non-pk3 files on clients by writing so much crap into neededpaks that
3166  // Q_strcat cuts off the .pk3 extension.
3167 
3168  origpos += strlen(origpos);
3169 
3170  // Remote name
3171  Q_strcat(neededpaks, len, "@");
3172  Q_strcat(neededpaks, len, fs_serverReferencedPakNames[i]);
3173  Q_strcat(neededpaks, len, ".pk3");
3174 
3175  // Local name
3176  Q_strcat(neededpaks, len, "@");
3177  // Do we have one with the same name?
3178  if (FS_SV_FileExists(va("%s.pk3", fs_serverReferencedPakNames[i]))) {
3179  char st[MAX_ZPATH];
3180  // We already have one called this, we need to download it to another name
3181  // Make something up with the checksum in it
3182  Com_sprintf(st, sizeof(st), "%s.%08x.pk3", fs_serverReferencedPakNames[i], fs_serverReferencedPaks[i]);
3183  Q_strcat(neededpaks, len, st);
3184  } else {
3185  Q_strcat(neededpaks, len, fs_serverReferencedPakNames[i]);
3186  Q_strcat(neededpaks, len, ".pk3");
3187  }
3188 
3189  // Find out whether it might have overflowed the buffer and don't add this file to the
3190  // list if that is the case.
3191  if (strlen(origpos) + (origpos - neededpaks) >= len - 1) {
3192  *origpos = '\0';
3193  break;
3194  }
3195  } else {
3196  Q_strcat(neededpaks, len, fs_serverReferencedPakNames[i]);
3197  Q_strcat(neededpaks, len, ".pk3");
3198  // Do we have one with the same name?
3199  if (FS_SV_FileExists(va("%s.pk3", fs_serverReferencedPakNames[i]))) {
3200  Q_strcat(neededpaks, len, " (local file exists with wrong checksum)");
3201  }
3202  Q_strcat(neededpaks, len, "\n");
3203  }
3204  }
3205  }
3206 
3207  if (*neededpaks) {
3208  return qtrue;
3209  }
3210 
3211  return qfalse; // We have them all
3212 }

Referenced by CL_InitDownloads().

◆ FS_FileExists()

qboolean FS_FileExists ( const char *  file)

Tests if the file exists in the current gamedir, this DOES NOT search the paths.

This is to determine if opening a file to write (which always goes into the current gamedir) will cause any overwrites.

)

Definition at line 1737 of file files.c.

1738 {
1739  searchpath_t* search;
1740  pack_t* pak;
1741  fileInPack_t* pakFile;
1742  long hash = 0;
1743 
1744  if (!fs_searchpaths) {
1745  Com_Error(ERR_FATAL, "Filesystem call made without initialization");
1746  }
1747 
1748  if (!filename) {
1749  Com_Error(ERR_FATAL, "FS_FOpenFileRead: NULL 'filename' parameter passed");
1750  }
1751 
1752  // qpaths are not supposed to have a leading slash
1753  if (filename[0] == '/' || filename[0] == '\\') {
1754  filename++;
1755  }
1756 
1757  // make absolutely sure that it can't back up the path.
1758  // The searchpaths do guarantee that something will always
1759  // be prepended, so we don't need to worry about "c:" or "//limbo"
1760  if (strstr(filename, "..") || strstr(filename, "::")) {
1761  return -1;
1762  }
1763 
1764  //
1765  // search through the path, one element at a time
1766  //
1767 
1768  for (search = fs_searchpaths; search; search = search->next) {
1769  //
1770  if (search->pack) {
1771  hash = FS_HashFileName(filename, search->pack->hashSize);
1772  }
1773  // is the element a pak file?
1774  if (search->pack && search->pack->hashTable[hash]) {
1775  // disregard if it doesn't match one of the allowed pure pak files
1776  if (!FS_PakIsPure(search->pack)) {
1777  continue;
1778  }
1779 
1780  // look through all the pak file elements
1781  pak = search->pack;
1782  pakFile = pak->hashTable[hash];
1783  do {
1784  // case and separator insensitive comparisons
1785  if (!FS_FilenameCompare(pakFile->name, filename)) {
1786  if (pChecksum) {
1787  *pChecksum = pak->pure_checksum;
1788  }
1789  return 1;
1790  }
1791  pakFile = pakFile->next;
1792  } while (pakFile != NULL);
1793  }
1794  }
1795  return -1;
1796 }

Definition at line 1039 of file files.c.

1040 {
1041  int c1, c2;
1042 
1043  do {
1044  c1 = *s1++;
1045  c2 = *s2++;
1046 
1047  if (c1 >= 'a' && c1 <= 'z') {
1048  c1 -= ('a' - 'A');
1049  }
1050  if (c2 >= 'a' && c2 <= 'z') {
1051  c2 -= ('a' - 'A');
1052  }
1053 
1054  if (c1 == '\\' || c1 == ':') {
1055  c1 = '/';
1056  }
1057  if (c2 == '\\' || c2 == ':') {
1058  c2 = '/';
1059  }
1060 
1061  if (c1 != c2) {
1062  return qtrue; // strings not equal
1063  }
1064  } while (c1);
1065 
1066  return qfalse; // strings are equal
1067 }

◆ FS_FindVM()

int FS_FindVM ( void **  startSearch,
char *  found,
int  foundlen,
const char *  name,
int  enableDll 
)

Find a suitable VM file in search path order.

In each searchpath try:

  • open DLL file if DLL loading enabled
  • open QVM file

Enable search for DLL by setting enableDll to FSVM_ENABLEDLL.

write found DLL or QVM to "found" and return VMI_NATIVE if DLL, VMI_COMPILED if QVM. Return the searchpath in "startSearch".

Parameters
startSearch
found
foundlen
name
enableDll
Returns
Return the searchpath in "startSearch".

Definition at line 1426 of file files.c.

1427 {
1428  searchpath_t* search, * lastSearch;
1429  directory_t* dir;
1430  pack_t* pack;
1431  char dllName[MAX_OSPATH], qvmName[MAX_OSPATH];
1432  char* netpath;
1433 
1434  if (!fs_searchpaths)
1435  Com_Error(ERR_FATAL, "Filesystem call made without initialization");
1436 
1437  if (enableDll)
1438  Com_sprintf(dllName, sizeof(dllName), "%s" ARCH_STRING DLL_EXT, name);
1439 
1440  Com_sprintf(qvmName, sizeof(qvmName), "vm/%s.qvm", name);
1441 
1442  lastSearch = *startSearch;
1443  if (*startSearch == NULL)
1444  search = fs_searchpaths;
1445  else
1446  search = lastSearch->next;
1447 
1448  while (search) {
1449  if (search->dir && !fs_numServerPaks) {
1450  dir = search->dir;
1451 
1452  if (enableDll) {
1453  netpath = FS_BuildOSPath(dir->path, dir->gamedir, dllName);
1454 
1455  if (FS_FileInPathExists(netpath)) {
1456  Q_strncpyz(found, netpath, foundlen);
1457  *startSearch = search;
1458 
1459  return VMI_NATIVE;
1460  }
1461  }
1462 
1463  if (FS_FOpenFileReadDir(qvmName, search, NULL, qfalse, qfalse) > 0) {
1464  *startSearch = search;
1465  return VMI_COMPILED;
1466  }
1467  } else if (search->pack) {
1468  pack = search->pack;
1469 
1470  if (lastSearch && lastSearch->pack) {
1471  // make sure we only try loading one VM file per game dir
1472  // i.e. if VM from pak7.pk3 fails we won't try one from pak6.pk3
1473 
1474  if (!FS_FilenameCompare(lastSearch->pack->pakPathname, pack->pakPathname)) {
1475  search = search->next;
1476  continue;
1477  }
1478  }
1479 
1480  if (FS_FOpenFileReadDir(qvmName, search, NULL, qfalse, qfalse) > 0) {
1481  *startSearch = search;
1482 
1483  return VMI_COMPILED;
1484  }
1485  }
1486 
1487  search = search->next;
1488  }
1489 
1490  return -1;
1491 }

◆ FS_FOpenFileRead()

long FS_FOpenFileRead ( const char *  filename,
fileHandle_t *  file,
qboolean  uniqueFILE 
)

Finds the file in the search path.

Returns filesize and an open FILE pointer. Used for streaming data out of either a separate file or a ZIP file.

If uniqueFILE is true, then a new FILE will be fopened, even if the file is found in an already open pak file. If uniqueFILE is false, you must call FS_FCloseFile instead of fclose, otherwise the pak FILE would be improperly closed. It is generally safe to always set uniqueFILE to true, because the majority of file IO goes through FS_ReadFile, which Does The Right Thing already.

Parameters
filename
file
uniqueFILE
Returns
Returns filesize and an open FILE pointer.

Definition at line 1366 of file files.c.

1367 {
1368  searchpath_t* search;
1369  long len;
1370  qboolean isLocalConfig;
1371 
1372  if (!fs_searchpaths)
1373  Com_Error(ERR_FATAL, "Filesystem call made without initialization");
1374 
1375  isLocalConfig = !strcmp(filename, "autoexec.cfg") || !strcmp(filename, Q3CONFIG_CFG);
1376  for (search = fs_searchpaths; search; search = search->next) {
1377  // autoexec.cfg and q3config.cfg can only be loaded outside of pk3 files.
1378  if (isLocalConfig && search->pack)
1379  continue;
1380 
1381  len = FS_FOpenFileReadDir(filename, search, file, uniqueFILE, qfalse);
1382 
1383  if (file == NULL) {
1384  if (len > 0)
1385  return len;
1386  } else {
1387  if (len >= 0 && *file)
1388  return len;
1389  }
1390 
1391  }
1392 
1393 #ifdef FS_MISSING
1394  if (missingFiles)
1395  fprintf(missingFiles, "%s\n", filename);
1396 #endif
1397 
1398  if (file) {
1399  *file = 0;
1400  return -1;
1401  } else {
1402  // When file is NULL, we're querying the existence of the file
1403  // If we've got here, it doesn't exist
1404  return 0;
1405  }
1406 }

◆ FS_GetModList()

int FS_GetModList ( char *  listbuf,
int  bufsize 
)

Returns a list of mod directory names.

A mod directory is a peer to baseq3 with a pk3 or pk3dir in it.

Parameters
listbuf
bufsize
Returns
Returns a list of mod directory names.

Definition at line 2537 of file files.c.

2538 {
2539  int nMods, i, j, k, nTotal, nLen, nPaks, nDirs, nPakDirs, nPotential, nDescLen;
2540  char** pFiles = NULL;
2541  char** pPaks = NULL;
2542  char** pDirs = NULL;
2543  char* name, * path;
2544  char description[MAX_OSPATH];
2545 
2546  int dummy;
2547  char** pFiles0 = NULL;
2548  qboolean bDrop = qfalse;
2549 
2550  // paths to search for mods
2551  const char* const paths[] = { fs_basepath->string, fs_homepath->string, fs_steampath->string, fs_gogpath->string };
2552 
2553  *listbuf = 0;
2554  nMods = nTotal = 0;
2555 
2556  // iterate through paths and get list of potential mods
2557  for (i = 0; i < ARRAY_LEN(paths); i++) {
2558  pFiles0 = Sys_ListFiles(paths[i], NULL, NULL, &dummy, qtrue);
2559  // Sys_ConcatenateFileLists frees the lists so Sys_FreeFileList isn't required
2560  pFiles = Sys_ConcatenateFileLists(pFiles, pFiles0);
2561  }
2562 
2563  nPotential = Sys_CountFileList(pFiles);
2564 
2565  for (i = 0; i < nPotential; i++) {
2566  name = pFiles[i];
2567  // NOTE: cleaner would involve more changes
2568  // ignore duplicate mod directories
2569  if (i != 0) {
2570  bDrop = qfalse;
2571  for (j = 0; j < i; j++) {
2572  if (Q_stricmp(pFiles[j], name) == 0) {
2573  // this one can be dropped
2574  bDrop = qtrue;
2575  break;
2576  }
2577  }
2578  }
2579  // we also drop "baseq3" "." and ".."
2580  if (bDrop || Q_stricmp(name, com_basegame->string) == 0 || Q_stricmpn(name, ".", 1) == 0) {
2581  continue;
2582  }
2583 
2584  // in order to be a valid mod the directory must contain at least one .pk3 or .pk3dir
2585  // we didn't keep the information when we merged the directory names, as to what OS Path it was found under
2586  // so we will try each of them here
2587  for (j = 0; j < ARRAY_LEN(paths); j++) {
2588  path = FS_BuildOSPath(paths[j], name, "");
2589  nPaks = nDirs = nPakDirs = 0;
2590  pPaks = Sys_ListFiles(path, ".pk3", NULL, &nPaks, qfalse);
2591  pDirs = Sys_ListFiles(path, "/", NULL, &nDirs, qfalse);
2592  for (k = 0; k < nDirs; k++) {
2593  // we only want to count directories ending with ".pk3dir"
2594  if (FS_IsExt(pDirs[k], ".pk3dir", strlen(pDirs[k]))) {
2595  nPakDirs++;
2596  }
2597  }
2598  // we only use Sys_ListFiles to check whether files are present
2599  Sys_FreeFileList(pPaks);
2600  Sys_FreeFileList(pDirs);
2601 
2602  if (nPaks > 0 || nPakDirs > 0) {
2603  break;
2604  }
2605  }
2606 
2607  if (nPaks > 0 || nPakDirs > 0) {
2608  nLen = strlen(name) + 1;
2609  // nLen is the length of the mod path
2610  // we need to see if there is a description available
2611  FS_GetModDescription(name, description, sizeof(description));
2612  nDescLen = strlen(description) + 1;
2613 
2614  if (nTotal + nLen + 1 + nDescLen + 1 < bufsize) {
2615  strcpy(listbuf, name);
2616  listbuf += nLen;
2617  strcpy(listbuf, description);
2618  listbuf += nDescLen;
2619  nTotal += nLen + nDescLen;
2620  nMods++;
2621  } else {
2622  break;
2623  }
2624  }
2625  }
2626  Sys_FreeFileList(pFiles);
2627 
2628  return nMods;
2629 }

If the string is empty, all data sources will be allowed.

If not empty, only pk3 files that match one of the space separated checksums will be checked for files, with the sole exception of .cfg files.

1502 {
1503  int block, remaining;
1504  int read;
1505  byte* buf;
1506  int tries;
1507 
1508  if (!fs_searchpaths) {
1509  Com_Error(ERR_FATAL, "Filesystem call made without initialization");
1510  }
1511 
1512  if (!f) {
1513  return 0;
1514  }
1515 
1516  buf = (byte*)buffer;
1517  fs_readCount += len;
1518 
1519  if (fsh[f].zipFile == qfalse) {
1520  remaining = len;
1521  tries = 0;
1522  while (remaining) {
1523  block = remaining;
1524  read = fread(buf, 1, block, fsh[f].handleFiles.file.o);
1525  if (read == 0) {
1526  // we might have been trying to read from a CD, which
1527  // sometimes returns a 0 read on windows
1528  if (!tries) {
1529  tries = 1;
1530  } else {
1531  return len - remaining; //Com_Error (ERR_FATAL, "FS_Read: 0 bytes read");
1532  }
1533  }
1534 
1535  if (read == -1) {
1536  Com_Error(ERR_FATAL, "FS_Read: -1 bytes read");
1537  }
1538 
1539  remaining -= read;
1540  buf += read;
1541  }
1542  return len;
1543  } else {
1544  return unzReadCurrentFile(fsh[f].handleFiles.file.z, buffer, len);
1545  }
1546 }

◆ FS_ReadFile()

long FS_ReadFile ( const char *  qpath,
void **  buffer 
)

Read the file.

Filename are relative to the quake search path.

as a quick check for existence. -1 length == not present A 0 byte will always be appended at the end, so string ops are safe. the buffer should be considered read-only, because it may be cached for other uses.

Parameters
qpath
buffer
Returns
The length of the file. A null buffer will just return the file length without loading.

)

Read the file directory.

Filename are relative to the quake search path. If searchPath is non-NULL search only in that specific search path.

Parameters

Returns
The length of the file. A null buffer will just return the file length without loading.

1817

1819  Com_Error(ERR_FATAL, "Filesystem call made without initialization");
1820  }
1821 
1822  if (!qpath || !qpath[0]) {
1823  Com_Error(ERR_FATAL, "FS_ReadFile with empty name");
1824  }
1825 
1826  buf = NULL; // quiet compiler warning
1827 
1828  // if this is a .cfg file and we are playing back a journal, read
1829  // it from the journal file
1830  if (strstr(qpath, ".cfg")) {
1831  isConfig = qtrue;
1832  if (com_journal && com_journal->integer == 2) {
1833  int r;
1834 
1835  Com_DPrintf("Loading %s from journal file.\n", qpath);
1836  r = FS_Read(&len, sizeof(len), com_journalDataFile);
1837  if (r != sizeof(len)) {
1838  if (buffer != NULL) *buffer = NULL;
1839  return -1;
1840  }
1841  // if the file didn't exist when the journal was created
1842  if (!len) {
1843  if (buffer == NULL) {
1844  return 1; // hack for old journal files
1845  }
1846  *buffer = NULL;
1847  return -1;
1848  }
1849  if (buffer == NULL) {
1850  return len;
1851  }
1852 
1853  buf = Hunk_AllocateTempMemory(len + 1);
1854  *buffer = buf;
1855 
1856  r = FS_Read(buf, len, com_journalDataFile);
1857  if (r != len) {
1858  Com_Error(ERR_FATAL, "Read from journalDataFile failed");
1859  }
1860 
1861  fs_loadCount++;
1862  fs_loadStack++;
1863 
1864  // guarantee that it will have a trailing 0 for string operations
1865  buf[len] = 0;
1866 
1867  return len;
1868  }
1869  } else {
1870  isConfig = qfalse;
1871  }
1872 
1873  search = searchPath;
1874 
1875  if (search == NULL) {
1876  // look for it in the filesystem or pack files
1877  len = FS_FOpenFileRead(qpath, &h, qfalse);
1878  } else {
1879  // look for it in a specific search path only
1880  len = FS_FOpenFileReadDir(qpath, search, &h, qfalse, unpure);
1881  }
1882 
1883  if (h == 0) {
1884  if (buffer) {
1885  *buffer = NULL;
1886  }
1887  // if we are journalling and it is a config file, write a zero to the journal file
1888  if (isConfig && com_journal && com_journal->integer == 1) {
1889  Com_DPrintf("Writing zero for %s to journal file.\n", qpath);
1890  len = 0;
1891  FS_Write(&len, sizeof(len), com_journalDataFile);
1892  FS_Flush(com_journalDataFile);
1893  }
1894  return -1;
1895  }
1896 
1897  if (!buffer) {
1898  if (isConfig && com_journal && com_journal->integer == 1) {
1899  Com_DPrintf("Writing len for %s to journal file.\n", qpath);
1900  FS_Write(&len, sizeof(len), com_journalDataFile);
1901  FS_Flush(com_journalDataFile);
1902  }
1903  FS_FCloseFile(h);
1904  return len;
1905  }
1906 
1907  fs_loadCount++;
1908  fs_loadStack++;
1909 
1910  buf = Hunk_AllocateTempMemory(len + 1);
1911  *buffer = buf;
1912 
1913  FS_Read(buf, len, h);
1914 
1915  // guarantee that it will have a trailing 0 for string operations
1916  buf[len] = 0;
1917  FS_FCloseFile(h);
1918 
1919  // if we are journalling and it is a config file, write it to the journal file
1920  if (isConfig && com_journal && com_journal->integer == 1) {
1921  Com_DPrintf("Writing %s to journal file.\n", qpath);
1922  FS_Write(&len, sizeof(len), com_journalDataFile);
1923  FS_Write(buf, len, com_journalDataFile);
1924  FS_Flush(com_journalDataFile);
1925  }
1926  return len;
1927 }

◆ FS_ReferencedPakPureChecksums()

const char* FS_ReferencedPakPureChecksums ( void  )

Returns a space separated string containing the checksums of all loaded AND referenced pk3 files.

Servers with sv_pure set will get this string back from clients for pure validation.

Returns a space separated string containing the pure checksums of all referenced pk3 files. Servers with sv_pure set will get this string back from clients for pure validation. The string has a specific order, "cgame ui @ ref1 ref2 ref3 ...".

Returns

Definition at line 3724 of file files.c.

3725 {
3726  static char info[BIG_INFO_STRING];
3727  searchpath_t* search;
3728  int nFlags, numPaks, checksum;
3729 
3730  info[0] = 0;
3731 
3732  checksum = fs_checksumFeed;
3733  numPaks = 0;
3734  for (nFlags = FS_CGAME_REF; nFlags; nFlags = nFlags >> 1) {
3735  if (nFlags & FS_GENERAL_REF) {
3736  // add a delimter between must haves and general refs
3737  //Q_strcat(info, sizeof(info), "@ ");
3738  info[strlen(info) + 1] = '\0';
3739  info[strlen(info) + 2] = '\0';
3740  info[strlen(info)] = '@';
3741  info[strlen(info)] = ' ';
3742  }
3743  for (search = fs_searchpaths; search; search = search->next) {
3744  // is the element a pak file and has it been referenced based on flag?
3745  if (search->pack && (search->pack->referenced & nFlags)) {
3746  Q_strcat(info, sizeof(info), va("%i ", search->pack->pure_checksum));
3747  if (nFlags & (FS_CGAME_REF | FS_UI_REF)) {
3748  break;
3749  }
3750  checksum ^= search->pack->pure_checksum;
3751  numPaks++;
3752  }
3753  }
3754  }
3755  // last checksum is the encoded number of referenced pk3s
3756  checksum ^= numPaks;
3757  Q_strcat(info, sizeof(info), va("%i ", checksum));
3758 
3759  return info;
3760 }

Referenced by CL_SendPureChecksums().

◆ FS_Write()

int FS_Write ( const void *  buffer,
int  len,
fileHandle_t  h 
)

Properly handles partial writes.

Parameters

len
h
Returns

Definition at line 1556 of file files.c.

1557 {
1558  int block, remaining;
1559  int written;
1560  byte* buf;
1561  int tries;
1562  FILE* f;
1563 
1564  if (!fs_searchpaths) {
1565  Com_Error(ERR_FATAL, "Filesystem call made without initialization");
1566  }
1567 
1568  if (!h) {
1569  return 0;
1570  }
1571 
1572  f = FS_FileForHandle(h);
1573  buf = (byte*)buffer;
1574 
1575  remaining = len;
1576  tries = 0;
1577  while (remaining) {
1578  block = remaining;
1579  written = fwrite(buf, 1, block, f);
1580  if (written == 0) {
1581  if (!tries) {
1582  tries = 1;
1583  } else {
1584  Com_Printf("FS_Write: 0 bytes written\n");
1585  return 0;
1586  }
1587  }
1588 
1589  if (written == -1) {
1590  Com_Printf("FS_Write: -1 bytes written\n");
1591  return 0;
1592  }
1593 
1594  remaining -= written;
1595  buf += written;
1596  }
1597  if (fsh[h].handleSync) {
1598  fflush(f);
1599  }
1600  return len;
1601 }

228  /* this should never happen */
229  tnode->head = get_ppnode(huff);

231  }

244  } else {

◆ Huff_Compress()

void Huff_Compress ( msg_t *  buf,
int  offset 
)

Definition at line 397 of file huffman.c.

397  {
398  int i, ch, size;
399  byte seq[65536];
400  byte* buffer;
401  huff_t huff;
402 
403  size = mbuf->cursize - offset;
404  buffer = mbuf->data + offset;
405 
406  if (size<=0) {
407  return;
408  }
409 
410  Com_Memset(&huff, 0, sizeof(huff_t));
411  // Add the NYT (not yet transmitted) node into the tree/list */
412  huff.tree = huff.lhead = huff.loc[NYT] = &(huff.nodeList[huff.blocNode++]);
413  huff.tree->symbol = NYT;
414  huff.tree->weight = 0;
415  huff.lhead->next = huff.lhead->prev = NULL;
416  huff.tree->parent = huff.tree->left = huff.tree->right = NULL;
417 
418  seq[0] = (size>>8);
419  seq[1] = size&0xff;
420 
421  bloc = 16;
422 
423  for (i=0; i<size; i++ ) {
424  ch = buffer[i];
425  Huff_transmit(&huff, ch, seq, size<<3); /* Transmit symbol */
426  Huff_addRef(&huff, (byte)ch); /* Do update */
427  }
428 
429  bloc += 8; // next byte
430 
431  mbuf->cursize = (bloc>>3) + offset;
432  Com_Memcpy(mbuf->data+offset, seq, (bloc>>3));
433 }

◆ Huff_Decompress()

void Huff_Decompress ( msg_t *  buf,
int  offset 
)

Definition at line 343 of file huffman.c.

343  {
344  int ch, cch, i, j, size;
345  byte seq[65536];
346  byte* buffer;
347  huff_t huff;
348 
349  size = mbuf->cursize - offset;
350  buffer = mbuf->data + offset;
351 
352  if ( size <= 0 ) {
353  return;
354  }
355 
356  Com_Memset(&huff, 0, sizeof(huff_t));
357  // Initialize the tree & list with the NYT node
358  huff.tree = huff.lhead = huff.ltail = huff.loc[NYT] = &(huff.nodeList[huff.blocNode++]);
359  huff.tree->symbol = NYT;
360  huff.tree->weight = 0;
361  huff.lhead->next = huff.lhead->prev = NULL;
362  huff.tree->parent = huff.tree->left = huff.tree->right = NULL;
363 
364  cch = buffer[0]*256 + buffer[1];
365  // don't overflow with bad messages
366  if ( cch > mbuf->maxsize - offset ) {
367  cch = mbuf->maxsize - offset;
368  }
369  bloc = 16;
370 
371  for ( j = 0; j < cch; j++ ) {
372  ch = 0;
373  // don't overflow reading from the messages
374  // FIXME: would it be better to have an overflow check in get_bit ?
375  if ( (bloc >> 3) > size ) {
376  seq[j] = 0;
377  break;
378  }
379  Huff_Receive(huff.tree, &ch, buffer); /* Get a character */
380  if ( ch == NYT ) { /* We got a NYT, get the symbol associated with it */
381  ch = 0;
382  for ( i = 0; i < 8; i++ ) {
383  ch = (ch<<1) + get_bit(buffer);
384  }
385  }
386 
387  seq[j] = ch; /* Write symbol */
388 
389  Huff_addRef(&huff, (byte)ch); /* Increment node */
390  }
391  mbuf->cursize = cch + offset;
392  Com_Memcpy(mbuf->data + offset, seq, cch);
393 }

1793  // this allows the config and product id files ( journal files too ) to be loaded
1794  // by the file system without redunant routines in the file system utilizing different
1795  // memory systems

1797  {

1799  }

1806  Com_Error( ERR_DROP, "Hunk_AllocateTempMemory: failed on %i", size );
1807  }

1811  hunk_temp->temp += size;

1818  hunk_temp->tempHighwater = hunk_temp->temp;
1819  }
1820

1822  buf = (void *)(hdr+1);
1823 
1824  hdr->magic = HUNK_MAGIC;

1826 
1827  // don't bother clearing, because we are going to load a file over it
1828  return buf;
1829 }

◆ Hunk_FreeTempMemory()

1837  {
1838  hunkHeader_t *hdr;
1839

1842  // by the file system without redunant routines in the file system utilizing different
1843  // memory systems

1854  }

1859  // otherwise the memory will stay around until Hunk_ClearTempMemory

1863  } else {
1864  Com_Printf( "Hunk_FreeTempMemory: not the final block\n" );
1865  }
1866  } else {

1868  hunk_temp->temp -= hdr->size;
1869  } else {
1870  Com_Printf( "Hunk_FreeTempMemory: not the final block\n" );
1871  }
1872  }
1873 }

551  {
552  int hash, i;
553 
554  hash = 0;
555  for (i = 0; i < maxlen && string[i] != '\0'; i++) {
556  if (string[i] & 0x80 || string[i] == '%')
557  hash += '.' * (119 + i);
558  else
559  hash += string[i] * (119 + i);
560  }
561  hash = (hash ^ (hash >> 10) ^ (hash >> 20));
562  return hash;
563 }

480 
481  l = 0;
482  do {
483  c = MSG_ReadByte(msg); // use ReadByte so -1 is out of bounds
484  if ( c == -1 || c == 0 ) {
485  break;
486  }
487  // translate all fmt spec to avoid crash bugs
488  if ( c == '%' ) {
489  c = '.';
490  }
491  // don't allow higher ascii values

493  c = '.';
494  }

496  if ( l >= sizeof(string)-1 ) {
497  break;

500  } while (1);

◆ MSG_ReadBits()

int MSG_ReadBits ( msg_t *  msg,
int  bits 
)

Definition at line 175 of file msg.c.

175  {
176  int value;
177  int get;
178  qboolean sgn;
179  int i, nbits;
180 // FILE* fp;
181 
182  if ( msg->readcount > msg->cursize ) {
183  return 0;
184  }
185 
186  value = 0;
187 
188  if ( bits < 0 ) {
189  bits = -bits;
190  sgn = qtrue;
191  } else {
192  sgn = qfalse;
193  }
194 
195  if (msg->oob) {
196  if (msg->readcount + (bits>>3) > msg->cursize) {
197  msg->readcount = msg->cursize + 1;
198  return 0;
199  }
200 
201  if(bits==8)
202  {
203  value = msg->data[msg->readcount];
204  msg->readcount += 1;
205  msg->bit += 8;
206  }
207  else if(bits==16)
208  {
209  short temp;
210 
211  CopyLittleShort(&temp, &msg->data[msg->readcount]);
212  value = temp;
213  msg->readcount += 2;
214  msg->bit += 16;
215  }
216  else if(bits==32)
217  {
218  CopyLittleLong(&value, &msg->data[msg->readcount]);
219  msg->readcount += 4;
220  msg->bit += 32;
221  }
222  else
223  Com_Error(ERR_DROP, "can't read %d bits", bits);
224  } else {
225  nbits = 0;
226  if (bits&7) {
227  nbits = bits&7;
228  if (msg->bit + nbits > msg->cursize << 3) {
229  msg->readcount = msg->cursize + 1;
230  return 0;
231  }
232  for(i=0;i<nbits;i++) {
233  value |= (Huff_getBit(msg->data, &msg->bit)<<i);
234  }
235  bits = bits - nbits;
236  }
237  if (bits) {
238 // fp = fopen("c:\\netchan.bin", "a");
239  for(i=0;i<bits;i+=8) {
240  Huff_offsetReceive (msgHuff.decompressor.tree, &get, msg->data, &msg->bit, msg->cursize<<3);
241 // fwrite(&get, 1, 1, fp);
242  value = (unsigned int)value | ((unsigned int)get<<(i+nbits));
243 
244  if (msg->bit > msg->cursize<<3) {
245  msg->readcount = msg->cursize + 1;
246  return 0;
247  }
248  }
249 // fclose(fp);
250  }
251  msg->readcount = (msg->bit>>3)+1;
252  }
253  if ( sgn && bits > 0 && bits < 32 ) {
254  if ( value & ( 1 << ( bits - 1 ) ) ) {
255  value |= -1 ^ ( ( 1 << bits ) - 1 );
256  }
257  }
258 
259  return value;
260 }

945  }
946

948  startBit = msg->readcount * 8 - GENTITYNUM_BITS;
949  } else {
950  startBit = ( msg->readcount - 1 ) * 8 + msg->bit - GENTITYNUM_BITS;
951  }
952 
953  // check for a remove
954  if ( MSG_ReadBits( msg, 1 ) == 1 ) {
955  Com_Memset( to, 0, sizeof( *to ) );
956  to->number = MAX_GENTITIES - 1;
957  if ( cl_shownet && ( cl_shownet->integer >= 2 || cl_shownet->integer == -1 ) ) {
958  Com_Printf( "%3i: #%-3i remove\n", msg->readcount, number );
959  }
960  return;
961  }
962 
963  // check for no delta
964  if ( MSG_ReadBits( msg, 1 ) == 0 ) {
965  *to = *from;
966  to->number = number;
967  return;
968  }
969 
970  numFields = ARRAY_LEN( entityStateFields );
971  lc = MSG_ReadByte(msg);
972 
973  if ( lc > numFields || lc < 0 ) {
974  Com_Error( ERR_DROP, "invalid entityState field count" );
975  }
976 
977  // shownet 2/3 will interleave with other printed info, -1 will
978  // just print the delta records`
979  if ( cl_shownet && ( cl_shownet->integer >= 2 || cl_shownet->integer == -1 ) ) {
980  print = 1;
981  Com_Printf( "%3i: #%-3i ", msg->readcount, to->number );
982  } else {
983  print = 0;
984  }
985 
986  to->number = number;
987 
988  for ( i = 0, field = entityStateFields ; i < lc ; i++, field++ ) {
989  fromF = (int *)( (byte *)from + field->offset );
990  toF = (int *)( (byte *)to + field->offset );
991 
992  if ( ! MSG_ReadBits( msg, 1 ) ) {
993  // no change
994  *toF = *fromF;
995  } else {
996  if ( field->bits == 0 ) {
997  // float
998  if ( MSG_ReadBits( msg, 1 ) == 0 ) {
999  *(float *)toF = 0.0f;
1000  } else {
1001  if ( MSG_ReadBits( msg, 1 ) == 0 ) {
1002  // integral float
1003  trunc = MSG_ReadBits( msg, FLOAT_INT_BITS );
1004  // bias to allow equal parts positive and negative
1005  trunc -= FLOAT_INT_BIAS;
1006  *(float *)toF = trunc;
1007  if ( print ) {
1008  Com_Printf( "%s:%i ", field->name, trunc );
1009  }
1010  } else {
1011  // full floating point value
1012  *toF = MSG_ReadBits( msg, 32 );
1013  if ( print ) {
1014  Com_Printf( "%s:%f ", field->name, *(float *)toF );
1015  }
1016  }
1017  }
1018  } else {
1019  if ( MSG_ReadBits( msg, 1 ) == 0 ) {
1020  *toF = 0;
1021  } else {
1022  // integer
1023  *toF = MSG_ReadBits( msg, field->bits );
1024  if ( print ) {
1025  Com_Printf( "%s:%i ", field->name, *toF );
1026  }
1027  }
1028  }
1029 // pcount[i]++;
1030  }
1031  }

1033  fromF = (int *)( (byte *)from + field->offset );
1034  toF = (int *)( (byte *)to + field->offset );
1035  // no change
1036  *toF = *fromF;
1037  }
1038

1040  if ( msg->bit == 0 ) {
1041  endBit = msg->readcount * 8 - GENTITYNUM_BITS;
1042  } else {

1044  }

1046  }
1047 }

◆ MSG_WriteBigString()

void MSG_WriteBigString ( msg_t *  sb,
const char *  s 
)

Definition at line 340 of file msg.c.

340  {
341  if ( !s ) {
342  MSG_WriteData (sb, "", 1);
343  } else {
344  int l,i;
345  char string[BIG_INFO_STRING];
346 
347  l = strlen( s );
348  if ( l >= BIG_INFO_STRING ) {
349  Com_Printf( "MSG_WriteString: BIG_INFO_STRING" );
350  MSG_WriteData (sb, "", 1);
351  return;
352  }
353  Q_strncpyz( string, s, sizeof( string ) );
354 
355  // get rid of 0x80+ and '%' chars, because old clients don't like them
356  for ( i = 0 ; i < l ; i++ ) {
357  if ( ((byte *)string)[i] > 127 || string[i] == '%' ) {
358  string[i] = '.';
359  }
360  }
361

363  }
364 }

◆ MSG_WriteBits()

void MSG_WriteBits ( msg_t *  msg,
int  value,
int  bits 
)

Definition at line 105 of file msg.c.

105  {
106  int i;
107 
108  oldsize += bits;
109 
110  if ( msg->overflowed ) {
111  return;
112  }
113 
114  if ( bits == 0 || bits < -31 || bits > 32 ) {
115  Com_Error( ERR_DROP, "MSG_WriteBits: bad bits %i", bits );
116  }
117 
118  if ( bits < 0 ) {
119  bits = -bits;
120  }
121 
122  if ( msg->oob ) {
123  if ( msg->cursize + ( bits >> 3 ) > msg->maxsize ) {
124  msg->overflowed = qtrue;
125  return;
126  }
127 
128  if ( bits == 8 ) {
129  msg->data[msg->cursize] = value;
130  msg->cursize += 1;
131  msg->bit += 8;
132  } else if ( bits == 16 ) {
133  short temp = value;
134 
135  CopyLittleShort( &msg->data[msg->cursize], &temp );
136  msg->cursize += 2;
137  msg->bit += 16;
138  } else if ( bits==32 ) {
139  CopyLittleLong( &msg->data[msg->cursize], &value );
140  msg->cursize += 4;
141  msg->bit += 32;
142  } else {
143  Com_Error( ERR_DROP, "can't write %d bits", bits );
144  }
145  } else {
146  value &= (0xffffffff >> (32 - bits));
147  if ( bits&7 ) {
148  int nbits;
149  nbits = bits&7;
150  if ( msg->bit + nbits > msg->maxsize << 3 ) {
151  msg->overflowed = qtrue;
152  return;
153  }
154  for( i = 0; i < nbits; i++ ) {
155  Huff_putBit( (value & 1), msg->data, &msg->bit );
156  value = (value >> 1);
157  }
158  bits = bits - nbits;
159  }
160  if ( bits ) {
161  for( i = 0; i < bits; i += 8 ) {
162  Huff_offsetTransmit( &msgHuff.compressor, (value & 0xff), msg->data, &msg->bit, msg->maxsize << 3 );
163  value = (value >> 8);
164 
165  if ( msg->bit > msg->maxsize << 3 ) {
166  msg->overflowed = qtrue;
167  return;
168  }
169  }
170  }
171  msg->cursize = (msg->bit >> 3) + 1;
172  }
173 }

◆ MSG_WriteDeltaEntity()

void MSG_WriteDeltaEntity ( msg_t *  msg,
struct entityState_s *  from,
struct entityState_s *  to,
qboolean  force 
)

Definition at line 816 of file msg.c.

817  {
818  int i, lc;
819  int numFields;
820  netField_t *field;
821  int trunc;
822  float fullFloat;
823  int *fromF, *toF;
824 
825  numFields = ARRAY_LEN( entityStateFields );
826 
827  // all fields should be 32 bits to avoid any compiler packing issues
828  // the "number" field is not part of the field list
829  // if this assert fails, someone added a field to the entityState_t
830  // struct without updating the message fields
831  assert( numFields + 1 == sizeof( *from )/4 );
832 
833  // a NULL to is a delta remove message
834  if ( to == NULL ) {
835  if ( from == NULL ) {
836  return;
837  }
838  MSG_WriteBits( msg, from->number, GENTITYNUM_BITS );
839  MSG_WriteBits( msg, 1, 1 );
840  return;
841  }
842 
843  if ( to->number < 0 || to->number >= MAX_GENTITIES ) {
844  Com_Error (ERR_FATAL, "MSG_WriteDeltaEntity: Bad entity number: %i", to->number );
845  }
846 
847  lc = 0;
848  // build the change vector as bytes so it is endien independent
849  for ( i = 0, field = entityStateFields ; i < numFields ; i++, field++ ) {
850  fromF = (int *)( (byte *)from + field->offset );
851  toF = (int *)( (byte *)to + field->offset );
852  if ( *fromF != *toF ) {
853  lc = i+1;
854  }
855  }
856 
857  if ( lc == 0 ) {
858  // nothing at all changed
859  if ( !force ) {
860  return; // nothing at all
861  }
862  // write two bits for no change
863  MSG_WriteBits( msg, to->number, GENTITYNUM_BITS );
864  MSG_WriteBits( msg, 0, 1 ); // not removed
865  MSG_WriteBits( msg, 0, 1 ); // no delta
866  return;
867  }
868 
869  MSG_WriteBits( msg, to->number, GENTITYNUM_BITS );
870  MSG_WriteBits( msg, 0, 1 ); // not removed
871  MSG_WriteBits( msg, 1, 1 ); // we have a delta
872 
873  MSG_WriteByte( msg, lc ); // # of changes
874 
875  oldsize += numFields;
876 
877  for ( i = 0, field = entityStateFields ; i < lc ; i++, field++ ) {
878  fromF = (int *)( (byte *)from + field->offset );
879  toF = (int *)( (byte *)to + field->offset );
880 
881  if ( *fromF == *toF ) {
882  MSG_WriteBits( msg, 0, 1 ); // no change
883  continue;
884  }
885 
886  MSG_WriteBits( msg, 1, 1 ); // changed
887 
888  if ( field->bits == 0 ) {
889  // float
890  fullFloat = *(float *)toF;
891  trunc = (int)fullFloat;
892 
893  if (fullFloat == 0.0f) {
894  MSG_WriteBits( msg, 0, 1 );
895  oldsize += FLOAT_INT_BITS;
896  } else {
897  MSG_WriteBits( msg, 1, 1 );
898  if ( trunc == fullFloat && trunc + FLOAT_INT_BIAS >= 0 &&
899  trunc + FLOAT_INT_BIAS < ( 1 << FLOAT_INT_BITS ) ) {
900  // send as small integer
901  MSG_WriteBits( msg, 0, 1 );
902  MSG_WriteBits( msg, trunc + FLOAT_INT_BIAS, FLOAT_INT_BITS );
903  } else {
904  // send as full floating point value
905  MSG_WriteBits( msg, 1, 1 );
906  MSG_WriteBits( msg, *toF, 32 );
907  }
908  }
909  } else {
910  if (*toF == 0) {
911  MSG_WriteBits( msg, 0, 1 );
912  } else {
913  MSG_WriteBits( msg, 1, 1 );
914  // integer
915  MSG_WriteBits( msg, *toF, field->bits );
916  }
917  }
918  }
919 }

1205  }

1210  powerupbits |= 1<<i;
1211  }
1212  }
1213

1215  MSG_WriteBits( msg, 0, 1 ); // no change

1217  return;

qboolean NET_CompareBaseAdrMask ( netadr_t  a,

396  return qfalse;

◆ NET_Config()

void NET_Config ( qboolean  enableNetworking)

Definition at line 1492 of file net_ip.c.

1492  {
1493  qboolean modified;
1494  qboolean stop;
1495  qboolean start;
1496 
1497  // get any latched changes to cvars
1498  modified = NET_GetCvars();
1499 
1500  if( !net_enabled->integer ) {
1501  enableNetworking = 0;
1502  }
1503 
1504  // if enable state is the same and no cvars were modified, we have nothing to do
1505  if( enableNetworking == networkingEnabled && !modified ) {
1506  return;
1507  }
1508 
1509  if( enableNetworking == networkingEnabled ) {
1510  if( enableNetworking ) {
1511  stop = qtrue;
1512  start = qtrue;
1513  }
1514  else {
1515  stop = qfalse;
1516  start = qfalse;
1517  }
1518  }
1519  else {
1520  if( enableNetworking ) {
1521  stop = qfalse;
1522  start = qtrue;
1523  }
1524  else {
1525  stop = qtrue;
1526  start = qfalse;
1527  }
1528  networkingEnabled = enableNetworking;
1529  }
1530 
1531  if( stop ) {
1532  if ( ip_socket != INVALID_SOCKET ) {
1533  closesocket( ip_socket );
1534  ip_socket = INVALID_SOCKET;
1535  }
1536 
1537  if(multicast6_socket != INVALID_SOCKET)
1538  {
1539  if(multicast6_socket != ip6_socket)
1540  closesocket(multicast6_socket);
1541 
1542  multicast6_socket = INVALID_SOCKET;
1543  }
1544

1546  closesocket( ip6_socket );
1547  ip6_socket = INVALID_SOCKET;
1548  }

1551  closesocket( socks_socket );
1552  socks_socket = INVALID_SOCKET;
1553  }
1554 
1555  }
1556 
1557  if( start )
1558  {
1559  if (net_enabled->integer)
1560  {
1561  NET_OpenIP();
1562  NET_SetMulticast6();
1563  }
1564  }
1565 }

◆ NET_StringToAdr()

int NET_StringToAdr ( const char *  s,
netadr_t *  a,
netadrtype_t  family 
)

630 {
631  char base[MAX_STRING_CHARS], *search;
632  char *port = NULL;
633 
634  if (!strcmp (s, "localhost")) {
635  Com_Memset (a, 0, sizeof(*a));
636  a->type = NA_LOOPBACK;
637 // as NA_LOOPBACK doesn't require ports report port was given.
638  return 1;
639  }
640 
641  Q_strncpyz( base, s, sizeof( base ) );
642 
643  if(*base == '[' || Q_CountChar(base, ':') > 1)
644  {
645  // This is an ipv6 address, handle it specially.
646  search = strchr(base, ']');
647  if(search)
648  {
649  *search = '\0';
650  search++;
651 
652  if(*search == ':')
653  port = search + 1;
654  }
655 
656  if(*base == '[')
657  search = base + 1;
658  else
659  search = base;
660  }
661  else
662  {
663  // look for a port number
664  port = strchr( base, ':' );
665 
666  if ( port ) {
667  *port = '\0';
668  port++;
669  }
670 
671  search = base;
672  }
673 
674  if(!Sys_StringToAdr(search, a, family))
675  {
676  a->type = NA_BAD;
677  return 0;
678  }
679

681  {
682  a->port = BigShort((short) atoi(port));
683  return 1;
684  }
685  else
686  {
687  a->port = BigShort(PORT_SERVER);
688  return 2;
689  }
690 }

◆ Netchan_Process()

qboolean Netchan_Process ( netchan_t *  chan,
msg_t *  msg 
)

Definition at line 244 of file net_chan.c.

244  {
245  int sequence;
246  int fragmentStart, fragmentLength;
247  qboolean fragmented;
248 
249  // XOR unscramble all data in the packet after the header
250 // Netchan_UnScramblePacket( msg );
251 
252  // get sequence numbers
253  MSG_BeginReadingOOB( msg );
254  sequence = MSG_ReadLong( msg );
255 
256  // check for fragment information
257  if ( sequence & FRAGMENT_BIT ) {
258  sequence &= ~FRAGMENT_BIT;
259  fragmented = qtrue;
260  } else {
261  fragmented = qfalse;
262  }
263 
264  // read the qport if we are a server
265  if ( chan->sock == NS_SERVER ) {
266  MSG_ReadShort( msg );
267  }
268 
269 #ifdef LEGACY_PROTOCOL
270  if(!chan->compat)
271 #endif
272  {
273  int checksum = MSG_ReadLong(msg);
274 
275  // UDP spoofing protection
276  if(NETCHAN_GENCHECKSUM(chan->challenge, sequence) != checksum)
277  return qfalse;
278  }
279 
280  // read the fragment information
281  if ( fragmented ) {
282  fragmentStart = MSG_ReadShort( msg );
283  fragmentLength = MSG_ReadShort( msg );
284  } else {
285  fragmentStart = 0; // stop warning message
286  fragmentLength = 0;
287  }
288 
289  if ( showpackets->integer ) {
290  if ( fragmented ) {
291  Com_Printf( "%s recv %4i : s=%i fragment=%i,%i\n"
292  , netsrcString[ chan->sock ]
293  , msg->cursize
294  , sequence
295  , fragmentStart, fragmentLength );
296  } else {
297  Com_Printf( "%s recv %4i : s=%i\n"
298  , netsrcString[ chan->sock ]
299  , msg->cursize
300  , sequence );
301  }
302  }
303 
304  //
305  // discard out of order or duplicated packets
306  //
307  if ( sequence <= chan->incomingSequence ) {
308  if ( showdrop->integer || showpackets->integer ) {
309  Com_Printf( "%s:Out of order packet %i at %i\n"
310  , NET_AdrToString( chan->remoteAddress )
311  , sequence
312  , chan->incomingSequence );
313  }
314  return qfalse;
315  }
316 
317  //
318  // dropped packets don't keep the message from being used
319  //
320  chan->dropped = sequence - (chan->incomingSequence+1);
321  if ( chan->dropped > 0 ) {
322  if ( showdrop->integer || showpackets->integer ) {
323  Com_Printf( "%s:Dropped %i packets at %i\n"
324  , NET_AdrToString( chan->remoteAddress )
325  , chan->dropped
326  , sequence );
327  }
328  }
329 
330 
331  //
332  // if this is the final framgent of a reliable message,
333  // bump incoming_reliable_sequence
334  //
335  if ( fragmented ) {
336  // TTimo
337  // make sure we add the fragments in correct order
338  // either a packet was dropped, or we received this one too soon
339  // we don't reconstruct the fragments. we will wait till this fragment gets to us again
340  // (NOTE: we could probably try to rebuild by out of order chunks if needed)
341  if ( sequence != chan->fragmentSequence ) {
342  chan->fragmentSequence = sequence;
343  chan->fragmentLength = 0;
344  }
345 
346  // if we missed a fragment, dump the message
347  if ( fragmentStart != chan->fragmentLength ) {
348  if ( showdrop->integer || showpackets->integer ) {
349  Com_Printf( "%s:Dropped a message fragment\n"
350  , NET_AdrToString( chan->remoteAddress ));
351  }
352  // we can still keep the part that we have so far,
353  // so we don't need to clear chan->fragmentLength
354  return qfalse;
355  }
356 
357  // copy the fragment to the fragment buffer
358  if ( fragmentLength < 0 || msg->readcount + fragmentLength > msg->cursize ||
359  chan->fragmentLength + fragmentLength > sizeof( chan->fragmentBuffer ) ) {
360  if ( showdrop->integer || showpackets->integer ) {
361  Com_Printf ("%s:illegal fragment length\n"
362  , NET_AdrToString (chan->remoteAddress ) );
363  }
364  return qfalse;
365  }
366 
367  Com_Memcpy( chan->fragmentBuffer + chan->fragmentLength,
368  msg->data + msg->readcount, fragmentLength );
369 
370  chan->fragmentLength += fragmentLength;
371 
372  // if this wasn't the last fragment, don't process anything
373  if ( fragmentLength == FRAGMENT_SIZE ) {
374  return qfalse;
375  }
376 
377  if ( chan->fragmentLength > msg->maxsize ) {
378  Com_Printf( "%s:fragmentLength %i > msg->maxsize\n"
379  , NET_AdrToString (chan->remoteAddress ),
380  chan->fragmentLength );
381  return qfalse;
382  }
383 
384  // copy the full message over the partial fragment
385 
386  // make sure the sequence number is still there
387  *(int *)msg->data = LittleLong( sequence );
388 
389  Com_Memcpy( msg->data + 4, chan->fragmentBuffer, chan->fragmentLength );
390  msg->cursize = chan->fragmentLength + 4;
391  chan->fragmentLength = 0;
392  msg->readcount = 4; // past the sequence number
393  msg->bit = 32; // past the sequence number
394 
395  // TTimo
396  // clients were not acking fragmented messages
397  chan->incomingSequence = sequence;
398 
399  return qtrue;
400  }
401 
402  //
403  // the message can now be read from the current message pointer
404  //
405  chan->incomingSequence = sequence;
406 
407  return qtrue;
408 }

◆ Netchan_Transmit()

void Netchan_Transmit ( netchan_t *  chan,
int  length,
const byte *  data 
)

Definition at line 177 of file net_chan.c.

177  {
178  msg_t send;
179  byte send_buf[MAX_PACKETLEN];
180 
181  if ( length > MAX_MSGLEN ) {
182  Com_Error( ERR_DROP, "Netchan_Transmit: length = %i", length );
183  }
184  chan->unsentFragmentStart = 0;
185 
186  // fragment large reliable messages
187  if ( length >= FRAGMENT_SIZE ) {
188  chan->unsentFragments = qtrue;
189  chan->unsentLength = length;
190  Com_Memcpy( chan->unsentBuffer, data, length );
191 
192  // only send the first fragment now
193  Netchan_TransmitNextFragment( chan );
194 
195  return;
196  }
197 
198  // write the packet header
199  MSG_InitOOB (&send, send_buf, sizeof(send_buf));
200 
201  MSG_WriteLong( &send, chan->outgoingSequence );
202 
203  // send the qport if we are a client
204  if(chan->sock == NS_CLIENT)
205  MSG_WriteShort(&send, qport->integer);
206 
207 #ifdef LEGACY_PROTOCOL
208  if(!chan->compat)
209 #endif
210  MSG_WriteLong(&send, NETCHAN_GENCHECKSUM(chan->challenge, chan->outgoingSequence));
211 
212  chan->outgoingSequence++;
213 
214  MSG_WriteData( &send, data, length );
215 
216  // send the datagram
217  NET_SendPacket( chan->sock, send.cursize, send.data, chan->remoteAddress );
218 
219  // Store send time and size of this packet for rate control
220  chan->lastSentTime = Sys_Milliseconds();
221  chan->lastSentSize = send.cursize;
222 
223  if ( showpackets->integer ) {
224  Com_Printf( "%s send %4i : s=%i ack=%i\n"
225  , netsrcString[ chan->sock ]
226  , send.cursize
227  , chan->outgoingSequence - 1
228  , chan->incomingSequence );
229  }
230 }

◆ Netchan_TransmitNextFragment()

void Netchan_TransmitNextFragment ( netchan_t *  chan)

Definition at line 109 of file net_chan.c.

109  {
110  msg_t send;
111  byte send_buf[MAX_PACKETLEN];
112  int fragmentLength;
113  int outgoingSequence;
114 
115  // write the packet header
116  MSG_InitOOB (&send, send_buf, sizeof(send_buf)); // <-- only do the oob here
117 
118  outgoingSequence = chan->outgoingSequence | FRAGMENT_BIT;
119  MSG_WriteLong(&send, outgoingSequence);
120 
121  // send the qport if we are a client
122  if ( chan->sock == NS_CLIENT ) {
123  MSG_WriteShort( &send, qport->integer );
124  }
125 
126 #ifdef LEGACY_PROTOCOL
127  if(!chan->compat)
128 #endif
129  MSG_WriteLong(&send, NETCHAN_GENCHECKSUM(chan->challenge, chan->outgoingSequence));
130 
131  // copy the reliable message to the packet first
132  fragmentLength = FRAGMENT_SIZE;
133  if ( chan->unsentFragmentStart + fragmentLength > chan->unsentLength ) {
134  fragmentLength = chan->unsentLength - chan->unsentFragmentStart;
135  }
136 
137  MSG_WriteShort( &send, chan->unsentFragmentStart );
138  MSG_WriteShort( &send, fragmentLength );
139  MSG_WriteData( &send, chan->unsentBuffer + chan->unsentFragmentStart, fragmentLength );
140 
141  // send the datagram
142  NET_SendPacket(chan->sock, send.cursize, send.data, chan->remoteAddress);
143 
144  // Store send time and size of this packet for rate control
145  chan->lastSentTime = Sys_Milliseconds();
146  chan->lastSentSize = send.cursize;
147 
148  if ( showpackets->integer ) {
149  Com_Printf ("%s send %4i : s=%i fragment=%i,%i\n"
150  , netsrcString[ chan->sock ]
151  , send.cursize
152  , chan->outgoingSequence
153  , chan->unsentFragmentStart, fragmentLength);
154  }
155 
156  chan->unsentFragmentStart += fragmentLength;
157 
158  // this exit condition is a little tricky, because a packet
159  // that is exactly the fragment length still needs to send
160  // a second packet of zero length so that the other side
161  // can tell there aren't more to follow
162  if ( chan->unsentFragmentStart == chan->unsentLength && fragmentLength != FRAGMENT_SIZE ) {
163  chan->outgoingSequence++;
164  chan->unsentFragments = qfalse;
165  }
166 }

◆ SV_Frame()

void SV_Frame ( int  msec)

Definition at line 1049 of file sv_main.c.

1049  {
1050  int frameMsec;
1051  int startTime;
1052 
1053  // the menu kills the server with this cvar
1054  if ( sv_killserver->integer ) {
1055  SV_Shutdown ("Server was killed");
1056  Cvar_Set( "sv_killserver", "0" );
1057  return;
1058  }
1059 
1060  if (!com_sv_running->integer)
1061  {
1062  // Running as a server, but no map loaded
1063 #ifdef DEDICATED
1064  // Block until something interesting happens
1065  Sys_Sleep(-1);
1066 #endif
1067 
1068  return;
1069  }
1070 
1071  // allow pause if only the local client is connected
1072  if ( SV_CheckPaused() ) {
1073  return;
1074  }
1075 
1076  // if it isn't time for the next frame, do nothing
1077  if ( sv_fps->integer < 1 ) {
1078  Cvar_Set( "sv_fps", "10" );
1079  }
1080 
1081  frameMsec = 1000 / sv_fps->integer * com_timescale->value;
1082  // don't let it scale below 1ms
1083  if(frameMsec < 1)
1084  {
1085  Cvar_Set("timescale", va("%f", sv_fps->integer / 1000.0f));
1086  frameMsec = 1;
1087  }
1088 
1089  sv.timeResidual += msec;
1090 
1091  if (!com_dedicated->integer) SV_BotFrame (sv.time + sv.timeResidual);
1092 
1093  // if time is about to hit the 32nd bit, kick all clients
1094  // and clear sv.time, rather
1095  // than checking for negative time wraparound everywhere.
1096  // 2giga-milliseconds = 23 days, so it won't be too often
1097  if ( svs.time > 0x70000000 ) {
1098  SV_Shutdown( "Restarting server due to time wrapping" );
1099  Cbuf_AddText( va( "map %s\n", Cvar_VariableString( "mapname" ) ) );
1100  return;
1101  }
1102  // this can happen considerably earlier when lots of clients play and the map doesn't change
1103  if ( svs.nextSnapshotEntities >= 0x7FFFFFFE - svs.numSnapshotEntities ) {
1104  SV_Shutdown( "Restarting server due to numSnapshotEntities wrapping" );
1105  Cbuf_AddText( va( "map %s\n", Cvar_VariableString( "mapname" ) ) );
1106  return;
1107  }
1108 
1109  if( sv.restartTime && sv.time >= sv.restartTime ) {
1110  sv.restartTime = 0;
1111  Cbuf_AddText( "map_restart 0\n" );
1112  return;
1113  }
1114 
1115  // update infostrings if anything has been changed
1116  if ( cvar_modifiedFlags & CVAR_SERVERINFO ) {
1117  SV_SetConfigstring( CS_SERVERINFO, Cvar_InfoString( CVAR_SERVERINFO ) );
1118  cvar_modifiedFlags &= ~CVAR_SERVERINFO;
1119  }
1120  if ( cvar_modifiedFlags & CVAR_SYSTEMINFO ) {
1121  SV_SetConfigstring( CS_SYSTEMINFO, Cvar_InfoString_Big( CVAR_SYSTEMINFO ) );
1122  cvar_modifiedFlags &= ~CVAR_SYSTEMINFO;
1123  }
1124 
1125  if ( com_speeds->integer ) {
1126  startTime = Sys_Milliseconds ();
1127  } else {
1128  startTime = 0; // quite a compiler warning
1129  }
1130 
1131  // update ping based on the all received frames
1132  SV_CalcPings();
1133 
1134  if (com_dedicated->integer) SV_BotFrame (sv.time);
1135 
1136  // run the game simulation in chunks
1137  while ( sv.timeResidual >= frameMsec ) {
1138  sv.timeResidual -= frameMsec;
1139  svs.time += frameMsec;
1140  sv.time += frameMsec;
1141 
1142  // let everything in the world think and move
1143  VM_Call (gvm, GAME_RUN_FRAME, sv.time);
1144  }
1145 
1146  if ( com_speeds->integer ) {
1147  time_game = Sys_Milliseconds () - startTime;
1148  }
1149 
1150  // check timeouts
1151  SV_CheckTimeouts();
1152 
1153  // send messages back to the clients
1154  SV_SendClientMessages();
1155 
1156  // send a heartbeat to the master if needed
1157  SV_MasterHeartbeat(HEARTBEAT_FOR_MASTER);
1158 }

◆ SV_FrameMsec()

int SV_FrameMsec ( void  )

1025 {
1026  if(sv_fps)
1027  {
1028  int frameMsec;
1029

1031 
1032  if(frameMsec < sv.timeResidual)
1033  return 0;
1034  else
1035  return frameMsec - sv.timeResidual;
1036  }
1037  else
1038  return 1;

Referenced by Com_Init().

◆ SV_PacketEvent()

void SV_PacketEvent ( netadr_t  from,
msg_t *  msg 
)

Definition at line 827 of file sv_main.c.

827  {
828  int i;
829  client_t *cl;
830  int qport;
831 
832  // check for connectionless packet (0xffffffff) first
833  if ( msg->cursize >= 4 && *(int *)msg->data == -1) {
834  SV_ConnectionlessPacket( from, msg );
835  return;
836  }
837 
838  // read the qport out of the message so we can fix up
839  // stupid address translating routers
840  MSG_BeginReadingOOB( msg );
841  MSG_ReadLong( msg ); // sequence number
842  qport = MSG_ReadShort( msg ) & 0xffff;
843 
844  // find which client the message is from
845  for (i=0, cl=svs.clients ; i < sv_maxclients->integer ; i++,cl++) {
846  if (cl->state == CS_FREE) {
847  continue;
848  }
849  if ( !NET_CompareBaseAdr( from, cl->netchan.remoteAddress ) ) {
850  continue;
851  }
852  // it is possible to have multiple clients from a single IP
853  // address, so they are differentiated by the qport variable
854  if (cl->netchan.qport != qport) {
855  continue;
856  }
857 
858  // the IP port can't be used to differentiate them, because
859  // some address translating routers periodically change UDP
860  // port assignments
861  if (cl->netchan.remoteAddress.port != from.port) {
862  Com_Printf( "SV_PacketEvent: fixing up a translated port\n" );
863  cl->netchan.remoteAddress.port = from.port;
864  }
865 
866  // make sure it is a valid, in sequence packet
867  if (SV_Netchan_Process(cl, msg)) {
868  // zombie clients still need to do the Netchan_Process
869  // to make sure they don't need to retransmit the final
870  // reliable message, but they don't do any other processing
871  if (cl->state != CS_ZOMBIE) {
872  cl->lastPacketTime = svs.time; // don't timeout
873  SV_ExecuteClientMessage( cl, msg );
874  }
875  }
876  return;
877  }
878 }

Referenced by Com_RunAndTimeServerPacket().

◆ SV_SendQueuedPackets()

int SV_SendQueuedPackets ( void  )

Definition at line 1220 of file sv_main.c.

1221 {
1222  int numBlocks;
1223  int dlStart, deltaT, delayT;
1224  static int dlNextRound = 0;
1225  int timeVal = INT_MAX;
1226 
1227  // Send out fragmented packets now that we're idle
1228  delayT = SV_SendQueuedMessages();
1229  if(delayT >= 0)
1230  timeVal = delayT;
1231 
1232  if(sv_dlRate->integer)
1233  {
1234  // Rate limiting. This is very imprecise for high
1235  // download rates due to millisecond timedelta resolution
1236  dlStart = Sys_Milliseconds();
1237  deltaT = dlNextRound - dlStart;
1238 
1239  if(deltaT > 0)
1240  {
1241  if(deltaT < timeVal)
1242  timeVal = deltaT + 1;
1243  }
1244  else
1245  {
1246  numBlocks = SV_SendDownloadMessages();
1247 
1248  if(numBlocks)
1249  {
1250  // There are active downloads
1251  deltaT = Sys_Milliseconds() - dlStart;
1252 
1253  delayT = 1000 * numBlocks * MAX_DOWNLOAD_BLKSIZE;
1254  delayT /= sv_dlRate->integer * 1024;
1255 
1256  if(delayT <= deltaT + 1)
1257  {
1258  // Sending the last round of download messages
1259  // took too long for given rate, don't wait for
1260  // next round, but always enforce a 1ms delay
1261  // between DL message rounds so we don't hog
1262  // all of the bandwidth. This will result in an
1263  // effective maximum rate of 1MB/s per user, but the
1264  // low download window size limits this anyways.
1265  if(timeVal > 2)
1266  timeVal = 2;
1267 
1268  dlNextRound = dlStart + deltaT + 1;
1269  }
1270  else
1271  {
1272  dlNextRound = dlStart + delayT;
1273  delayT -= deltaT;
1274 
1275  if(delayT < timeVal)
1276  timeVal = delayT;
1277  }
1278  }
1279  }
1280  }
1281  else
1282  {
1283  if(SV_SendDownloadMessages())
1284  timeVal = 0;
1285  }
1286 
1287  return timeVal;
1288 }

Referenced by Com_Frame().
