◆ Sys_IsLANAddress()

qboolean Sys_IsLANAddress ( netadr_t  adr)

Definition at line 708 of file net_ip.c.

708  {
709  int index, run, addrsize;
710  qboolean differed;
711  byte *compareadr, *comparemask, *compareip;
712 
713  if( adr.type == NA_LOOPBACK ) {
714  return qtrue;
715  }
716 
717  if( adr.type == NA_IP )
718  {
719  // RFC1918:
720  // 10.0.0.0 - 10.255.255.255 (10/8 prefix)
721  // 172.16.0.0 - 172.31.255.255 (172.16/12 prefix)
722  // 192.168.0.0 - 192.168.255.255 (192.168/16 prefix)
723  if(adr.ip[0] == 10)
724  return qtrue;
725  if(adr.ip[0] == 172 && (adr.ip[1]&0xf0) == 16)
726  return qtrue;
727  if(adr.ip[0] == 192 && adr.ip[1] == 168)
728  return qtrue;
729 
730  if(adr.ip[0] == 127)
731  return qtrue;
732  }
733  else if(adr.type == NA_IP6)
734  {
735  if(adr.ip6[0] == 0xfe && (adr.ip6[1] & 0xc0) == 0x80)
736  return qtrue;
737  if((adr.ip6[0] & 0xfe) == 0xfc)
738  return qtrue;
739  }
740 
741  // Now compare against the networks this computer is member of.
742  for(index = 0; index < numIP; index++)
743  {
744  if(localIP[index].type == adr.type)
745  {
746  if(adr.type == NA_IP)
747  {
748  compareip = (byte *) &((struct sockaddr_in *) &localIP[index].addr)->sin_addr.s_addr;
749  comparemask = (byte *) &((struct sockaddr_in *) &localIP[index].netmask)->sin_addr.s_addr;
750  compareadr = adr.ip;
751 
752  addrsize = sizeof(adr.ip);
753  }
754  else
755  {
756  // TODO? should we check the scope_id here?
757 
758  compareip = (byte *) &((struct sockaddr_in6 *) &localIP[index].addr)->sin6_addr;
759  comparemask = (byte *) &((struct sockaddr_in6 *) &localIP[index].netmask)->sin6_addr;
760  compareadr = adr.ip6;
761 
762  addrsize = sizeof(adr.ip6);
763  }
764 
765  differed = qfalse;
766  for(run = 0; run < addrsize; run++)
767  {
768  if((compareip[run] & comparemask[run]) != (compareadr[run] & comparemask[run]))
769  {
770  differed = qtrue;
771  break;
772  }
773  }
774 
775  if(!differed)
776  return qtrue;
777 
778  }
779  }
780 
781  return qfalse;
782 }

const char *  extension,
char *  filter,
int *  numfiles,
qboolean  wantsubs 
)

Definition at line 507 of file sys_win32.c.

508 {
509  char search[MAX_OSPATH];
510  int nfiles;
511  char **listCopy;
512  char *list[MAX_FOUND_FILES];
513  struct _finddata_t findinfo;
514  intptr_t findhandle;
515  int flag;
516  int i;
517  int extLen;
518 
519  if (filter) {
520 
521  nfiles = 0;
522  Sys_ListFilteredFiles( directory, "", filter, list, &nfiles );
523 
524  list[ nfiles ] = 0;
525  *numfiles = nfiles;
526 
527  if (!nfiles)
528  return NULL;
529 
530  listCopy = Z_Malloc( ( nfiles + 1 ) * sizeof( *listCopy ) );
531  for ( i = 0 ; i < nfiles ; i++ ) {
532  listCopy[i] = list[i];
533  }
534  listCopy[i] = NULL;
535 
536  return listCopy;
537  }
538 
539  if ( !extension) {
540  extension = "";
541  }
542 
543  // passing a slash as extension will find directories
544  if ( extension[0] == '/' && extension[1] == 0 ) {
545  extension = "";
546  flag = 0;
547  } else {
548  flag = _A_SUBDIR;
549  }
550 
551  extLen = strlen( extension );
552 
553  Com_sprintf( search, sizeof(search), "%s\\*%s", directory, extension );
554 
555  // search
556  nfiles = 0;
557 
558  findhandle = _findfirst (search, &findinfo);
559  if (findhandle == -1) {
560  *numfiles = 0;
561  return NULL;
562  }
563 
564  do {
565  if ( (!wantsubs && flag ^ ( findinfo.attrib & _A_SUBDIR )) || (wantsubs && findinfo.attrib & _A_SUBDIR) ) {
566  if (*extension) {
567  if ( strlen( findinfo.name ) < extLen ||
568  Q_stricmp(
569  findinfo.name + strlen( findinfo.name ) - extLen,
570  extension ) ) {
571  continue; // didn't match
572  }
573  }
574  if ( nfiles == MAX_FOUND_FILES - 1 ) {
575  break;
576  }
577  list[ nfiles ] = CopyString( findinfo.name );
578  nfiles++;
579  }
580  } while ( _findnext (findhandle, &findinfo) != -1 );
581 
582  list[ nfiles ] = 0;
583 
584  _findclose (findhandle);
585 
586  // return a copy of the list
587  *numfiles = nfiles;
588 
589  if ( !nfiles ) {
590  return NULL;
591  }
592 
593  listCopy = Z_Malloc( ( nfiles + 1 ) * sizeof( *listCopy ) );
594  for ( i = 0 ; i < nfiles ; i++ ) {
595  listCopy[i] = list[i];
596  }
597  listCopy[i] = NULL;
598 
599  do {
600  flag = 0;
601  for(i=1; i<nfiles; i++) {
602  if (strgtr(listCopy[i-1], listCopy[i])) {
603  char *temp = listCopy[i];
604  listCopy[i] = listCopy[i-1];
605  listCopy[i-1] = temp;
606  flag = 1;
607  }
608  }
609  } while(flag);
610 
611  return listCopy;
612 }

643  {

645  struct sockaddr_storage addr;
646 
647  if( to.type != NA_BROADCAST && to.type != NA_IP && to.type != NA_IP6 && to.type != NA_MULTICAST6)
648  {
649  Com_Error( ERR_FATAL, "Sys_SendPacket: bad address type" );
650  return;
651  }
652 
653  if( (ip_socket == INVALID_SOCKET && to.type == NA_IP) ||
654  (ip_socket == INVALID_SOCKET && to.type == NA_BROADCAST) ||
655  (ip6_socket == INVALID_SOCKET && to.type == NA_IP6) ||
656  (ip6_socket == INVALID_SOCKET && to.type == NA_MULTICAST6) )
657  return;

660  return;

666  socksBuf[0] = 0; // reserved
667  socksBuf[1] = 0;
668  socksBuf[2] = 0; // fragment (not fragmented)
669  socksBuf[3] = 1; // address type: IPV4
670  *(int *)&socksBuf[4] = ((struct sockaddr_in *)&addr)->sin_addr.s_addr;

672  memcpy( &socksBuf[10], data, length );
673  ret = sendto( ip_socket, socksBuf, length+10, 0, &socksRelayAddr, sizeof(socksRelayAddr) );
674  }
675  else {
676  if(addr.ss_family == AF_INET)
677  ret = sendto( ip_socket, data, length, 0, (struct sockaddr *) &addr, sizeof(struct sockaddr_in) );

679  ret = sendto( ip6_socket, data, length, 0, (struct sockaddr *) &addr, sizeof(struct sockaddr_in6) );
680  }
681  if( ret == SOCKET_ERROR ) {
682  int err = socketError;
683 
684  // wouldblock is silent
685  if( err == EAGAIN ) {
686  return;
687  }
688 
689  // some PPP links do not allow broadcasts and return an error
690  if( ( err == EADDRNOTAVAIL ) && ( ( to.type == NA_BROADCAST ) ) ) {
691  return;
692  }
693 
694  Com_Printf( "Sys_SendPacket: %s\n", NET_ErrorString() );
695  }
696 }

◆ VM_Call()

intptr_t QDECL VM_Call ( vm_t *  vm,
int  callNum,
  ... 
)

Definition at line 807 of file vm.c.

808 {
809  vm_t *oldVM;
810  intptr_t r;
811  int i;
812 
813  if(!vm || !vm->name[0])
814  Com_Error(ERR_FATAL, "VM_Call with NULL vm");
815 
816  oldVM = currentVM;
817  currentVM = vm;
818  lastVM = vm;
819 
820  if ( vm_debugLevel ) {
821  Com_Printf( "VM_Call( %d )\n", callnum );
822  }
823 
824  ++vm->callLevel;
825  // if we have a dll loaded, call it directly
826  if ( vm->entryPoint ) {
827  //rcg010207 - see dissertation at top of VM_DllSyscall() in this file.
828  int args[MAX_VMMAIN_ARGS-1];
829  va_list ap;
830  va_start(ap, callnum);
831  for (i = 0; i < ARRAY_LEN(args); i++) {
832  args[i] = va_arg(ap, int);
833  }
834  va_end(ap);
835 
836  r = vm->entryPoint( callnum, args[0], args[1], args[2], args[3],
837  args[4], args[5], args[6], args[7],
838  args[8], args[9], args[10], args[11]);
839  } else {
840 #if ( id386 || idsparc ) && !defined __clang__ // calling convention doesn't need conversion in some cases
841 #ifndef NO_VM_COMPILED
842  if ( vm->compiled )
843  r = VM_CallCompiled( vm, (int*)&callnum );
844  else
845 #endif
846  r = VM_CallInterpreted( vm, (int*)&callnum );
847 #else
848  struct {
849  int callnum;
850  int args[MAX_VMMAIN_ARGS-1];
851  } a;
852  va_list ap;
853 
854  a.callnum = callnum;
855  va_start(ap, callnum);
856  for (i = 0; i < ARRAY_LEN(a.args); i++) {
857  a.args[i] = va_arg(ap, int);
858  }
859  va_end(ap);
860 #ifndef NO_VM_COMPILED
861  if ( vm->compiled )
862  r = VM_CallCompiled( vm, &a.callnum );
863  else
864 #endif
865  r = VM_CallInterpreted( vm, &a.callnum );
866 #endif
867  }
868  --vm->callLevel;
869 
870  if ( oldVM != NULL )
871  currentVM = oldVM;
872  return r;
873 }

◆ VM_Create()

Definition at line 576 of file vm.c.

577  {
578  vm_t *vm;
579  vmHeader_t *header;
580  int i, remaining, retval;
581  char filename[MAX_OSPATH];
582  void *startSearch = NULL;
583 
584  if ( !module || !module[0] || !systemCalls ) {
585  Com_Error( ERR_FATAL, "VM_Create: bad parms" );
586  }
587 
588  remaining = Hunk_MemoryRemaining();
589 
590  // see if we already have the VM
591  for ( i = 0 ; i < MAX_VM ; i++ ) {
592  if (!Q_stricmp(vmTable[i].name, module)) {
593  vm = &vmTable[i];
594  return vm;
595  }
596  }
597 
598  // find a free vm
599  for ( i = 0 ; i < MAX_VM ; i++ ) {
600  if ( !vmTable[i].name[0] ) {
601  break;
602  }
603  }
604 
605  if ( i == MAX_VM ) {
606  Com_Error( ERR_FATAL, "VM_Create: no free vm_t" );
607  }
608 
609  vm = &vmTable[i];
610 
611  Q_strncpyz(vm->name, module, sizeof(vm->name));
612 
613  do
614  {
615  retval = FS_FindVM(&startSearch, filename, sizeof(filename), module, (interpret == VMI_NATIVE));
616 
617  if(retval == VMI_NATIVE)
618  {
619  Com_Printf("Try loading dll file %s\n", filename);
620 
621  vm->dllHandle = Sys_LoadGameDll(filename, &vm->entryPoint, VM_DllSyscall);
622 
623  if(vm->dllHandle)
624  {
625  vm->systemCall = systemCalls;
626  return vm;
627  }
628 
629  Com_Printf("Failed loading dll, trying next\n");
630  }
631  else if(retval == VMI_COMPILED)
632  {
633  vm->searchPath = startSearch;
634  if((header = VM_LoadQVM(vm, qtrue, qfalse)))
635  break;
636 
637  // VM_Free overwrites the name on failed load
638  Q_strncpyz(vm->name, module, sizeof(vm->name));
639  }
640  } while(retval >= 0);
641 
642  if(retval < 0)
643  return NULL;
644 
645  vm->systemCall = systemCalls;
646 
647  // allocate space for the jump targets, which will be filled in by the compile/prep functions
648  vm->instructionCount = header->instructionCount;
649  vm->instructionPointers = Hunk_Alloc(vm->instructionCount * sizeof(*vm->instructionPointers), h_high);
650 
651  // copy or compile the instructions
652  vm->codeLength = header->codeLength;
653 
654  vm->compiled = qfalse;
655 
656 #ifdef NO_VM_COMPILED
657  if(interpret >= VMI_COMPILED) {
658  Com_Printf("Architecture doesn't have a bytecode compiler, using interpreter\n");
659  interpret = VMI_BYTECODE;
660  }
661 #else
662  if(interpret != VMI_BYTECODE)
663  {
664  vm->compiled = qtrue;
665  VM_Compile( vm, header );
666  }
667 #endif
668  // VM_Compile may have reset vm->compiled if compilation failed
669  if (!vm->compiled)
670  {
671  VM_PrepareInterpreter( vm, header );
672  }
673 
674  // free the original file
675  FS_FreeFile( header );
676 
677  // load the map file
678  VM_LoadSymbols( vm );
679 
680  // the stack is implicitly at the end of the image
681  vm->programStack = vm->dataMask + 1;
682  vm->stackBottom = vm->programStack - PROGRAM_STACK_SIZE;
683 
684  Com_Printf("%s loaded in %d bytes on the hunk\n", module, remaining - Hunk_MemoryRemaining());
685 
686  return vm;
687 }

◆ Z_Free()

void Z_Free ( void *  ptr)

Definition at line 852 of file common.c.

852  {
853  memblock_t *block, *other;
854  memzone_t *zone;
855 
856  if (!ptr) {
857  Com_Error( ERR_DROP, "Z_Free: NULL pointer" );
858  }
859 
860  block = (memblock_t *) ( (byte *)ptr - sizeof(memblock_t));
861  if (block->id != ZONEID) {
862  Com_Error( ERR_FATAL, "Z_Free: freed a pointer without ZONEID" );
863  }
864  if (block->tag == 0) {
865  Com_Error( ERR_FATAL, "Z_Free: freed a freed pointer" );
866  }
867  // if static memory
868  if (block->tag == TAG_STATIC) {
869  return;
870  }
871 
872  // check the memory trash tester
873  if ( *(int *)((byte *)block + block->size - 4 ) != ZONEID ) {
874  Com_Error( ERR_FATAL, "Z_Free: memory block wrote past end" );
875  }
876 
877  if (block->tag == TAG_SMALL) {
878  zone = smallzone;
879  }
880  else {
881  zone = mainzone;
882  }
883 
884  zone->used -= block->size;
885  // set the block to something that should cause problems
886  // if it is referenced...
887  Com_Memset( ptr, 0xaa, block->size - sizeof( *block ) );
888 
889  block->tag = 0; // mark as free
890 
891  other = block->prev;
892  if (!other->tag) {
893  // merge with previous free block
894  other->size += block->size;
895  other->next = block->next;
896  other->next->prev = other;
897  if (block == zone->rover) {
898  zone->rover = other;
899  }
900  block = other;
901  }
902 
903  zone->rover = block;
904 
905  other = block->next;
906  if ( !other->tag ) {
907  // merge the next free block onto the end
908  block->size += other->size;
909  block->next = other->next;
910  block->next->prev = block;
911  }
912 }

948  {
949  int allocSize;
950 #else
951 void *Z_TagMalloc( int size, int tag ) {
952 #endif
953  int extra;
954  memblock_t *start, *rover, *new, *base;
955  memzone_t *zone;
956 
957  if (!tag) {
958  Com_Error( ERR_FATAL, "Z_TagMalloc: tried to use a 0 tag" );
959  }
960 
961  if ( tag == TAG_SMALL ) {
962  zone = smallzone;
963  }
964  else {
965  zone = mainzone;
966  }
967 
968 #ifdef ZONE_DEBUG
969  allocSize = size;
970 #endif
971  //
972  // scan through the block list looking for the first free block
973  // of sufficient size
974  //
975  size += sizeof(memblock_t); // account for size of block header
976  size += 4; // space for memory trash tester
977  size = PAD(size, sizeof(intptr_t)); // align to 32/64 bit boundary
978 
979  base = rover = zone->rover;
980  start = base->prev;
981 
982  do {
983  if (rover == start) {
984  // scaned all the way around the list
985 #ifdef ZONE_DEBUG
986  Z_LogHeap();
987 
988  Com_Error(ERR_FATAL, "Z_Malloc: failed on allocation of %i bytes from the %s zone: %s, line: %d (%s)",
989  size, zone == smallzone ? "small" : "main", file, line, label);
990 #else
991  Com_Error(ERR_FATAL, "Z_Malloc: failed on allocation of %i bytes from the %s zone",
992  size, zone == smallzone ? "small" : "main");
993 #endif
994  return NULL;
995  }
996  if (rover->tag) {
997  base = rover = rover->next;
998  } else {
999  rover = rover->next;
1000  }
1001  } while (base->tag || base->size < size);
1002 
1003  //
1004  // found a block big enough
1005  //
1006  extra = base->size - size;
1007  if (extra > MINFRAGMENT) {
1008  // there will be a free fragment after the allocated block
1009  new = (memblock_t *) ((byte *)base + size );
1010  new->size = extra;
1011  new->tag = 0; // free block
1012  new->prev = base;
1013  new->id = ZONEID;
1014  new->next = base->next;
1015  new->next->prev = new;
1016  base->next = new;
1017  base->size = size;
1018  }
1019 
1020  base->tag = tag; // no longer a free block
1021 
1022  zone->rover = base->next; // next allocation will start looking here
1023  zone->used += base->size; //
1024 
1025  base->id = ZONEID;
1026 
1027 #ifdef ZONE_DEBUG
1028  base->d.label = label;
1029  base->d.file = file;
1030  base->d.line = line;
1031  base->d.allocSize = allocSize;
1032 #endif
1033 
1034  // marker for memory trash testing
1035  *(int *)((byte *)base + base->size - 4) = ZONEID;
1036 
1037  return (void *) ((byte *)base + sizeof(memblock_t));
1038 }
